loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman who has been blessed with four children who are now adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nyamvula operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She joined Yehu to get financial support. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of beans, native rice and pepper for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his family, which consists of five members. Mahmoud is a university student majoring in Science and Technology Information, and he is in his second year. Mahmoud is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees so that he will continue his study and work in his field in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Nzoriha Group

texts.fr:
Siméon  fait partie du groupe Nzoriha et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 38  ans.

Il  fait le commerce de haricot et de manioc sec  depuis  5 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  de haricot et de manioc sec  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait  devenir un commercant grossiste.
texts.en:
Simeon is part of the Nzoriha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is a single 38-year-old. 

He has been trading in beans and dry cassava for the past five years. 

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of beans and dry cassava for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years, he would like to become a wholesale trader.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of beans and dry cassava for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, 55, is widowed and lives with her family in a village of the Cheung Prey district. She has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years and the current business earns her family about 46,000 KHR per day.

Yan has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Unyenyekevu Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mutewa est une commerçante depuis 15 ans, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Unyenyekevu». Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises à domicile dans un du quartier commercial. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 4 sacs de maïs, farine de manioc, tomates, fretins, braises etc. Son conjoint est un chauffeur dans une entreprise de la place. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit, pendant, ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The client Mutewa has been a merchant for the past 15 years. She is 45 years old, married with seven children, all of whom are studying. The client is a member of the Unyenyekevu business association.

She sells food products. She displays her goods locally in a shopping district stall. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her activity. She will buy four bags of maize, cassava flour, tomatoes, small fish, charcoal, etc.

Her spouse is a driver for a local company. She started her business with funds received from her husband. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable women entrepreneurs, by granting them loans during this difficult post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country. It should be noted that a client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: buy four bags of maize, cassava flour, tomatoes, small fish, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of beans, native rice and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Sreyorn's Group

texts.en:
Sreyorn is aged 21 and married with one kid. Her family lives in a village of the Cheung district of Kampong Cham province and she and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee for two years. The current business earns about 38,000 KHR per day.

Sreyorn is an existing client of VisionFund who has received a loan for one cycle. The past loan has helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Jeanette est une Couturière depuis 19 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Zamiri» âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est couturière et vendeuse des matériels de couture. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels de couture (machine a coudre, tissus, fil, aigouille etc.) et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs enleur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
The client Jeanette has been a seamstress for the past 19 years, and is member of a the Zamiri business association. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of six children, who are all studying.

She is a seamstress and also sells sewing materials. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. This new loan will serve to buy new sewing materials (sewing machine, fabric, thread, needles, etc.). She and her husband help each other out: she had received her first funding through her ​​husband.

In the future she wants to build a workshop and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs by granting them loans without collateral.

loans.use: buy new sewing material (sewing machine, fabric, thread, needles, etc.)

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Greda which is composed of two persons who are friends residing in the same area. The group representative, Afi, is the one standing on the left in the photograph. She is 37 years old and a single mother of one child. She ensures that her household expenses are covered. She stopped going to school at the elementary level.

To meet her needs and those of her child, Afi sells groceries, charcoal, wooden doors, chairs and nails. She has been operating her business for nearly four years. She gets her supplies from a market in Accra.

This fourth loan will surely enable Afi and her friend Honu to boost their businesses and increase their customer base, as well as their revenues.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries, charcoal, wooden doors, chairs and nails.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro lives in a village far from the center of her region. She lives together with her four children. Her husband died some years ago. She is a very hardworking woman. Zuhro has been busy growing crops for more than 15 years. She mainly grows wheat on 0.5 hectares of land. She also grows potatoes on 0.50 hectares of land. She sells the harvest in a local market. This business is the main source of the family income. Zuhro is going to buy mineral fertilizer for sowing her land but she doesn't have the money for it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizer. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for sowing her land

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old married father of two whose wife works as a teacher to assist him in covering their family's living expenses. Ali is a Palestinian refugee who works at an aluminum installation company in his neighborhood.

He has worked for 18 years in this field and he has gained lots of respect from his bosses for his hard work and reliability. His earnings, combined with his wife's, go to help improve his family's living conditions for which they are responsible.

Ali is an ambitious man who believes in taking advantage of every opportunity on the path to success. He has completed three previous loan cycles with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, which have positively impacted his family. His acquired loan will be invested in increasing his own newly established business that has to do with aluminum work.

Ali dreams of being financially stable and he hopes to establish his own wide business one day, that will be enough to cover his family's living, and resign from where he works now.

loans.use: to increase his own newly established business that has to do with aluminum work

loans.name: Javier Orlando

texts.es:
Javier Orlando tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y tres hijos en una comunidad tranquila de clima caluroso en el Caserío de Chiple, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de comida preparada por ella misma como arroz con pollo, arroz con pato, cabrito, tallarines verdes entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la implementación de equipos de cocina así como compra de insumos y de esta manera poder preparar nuevos potajes y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Javier Orlando, 47, is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and three children in a quiet community with a hot climate in a rural area of the Callayuc district. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The community is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells prepared food which he makes himself, such as rice with chicken, rice with duck, goat, noodles, and others. His business is located in his home. He has applied for a loan of 2,000 Peruvian nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to install equipment in his kitchen, as well as to buy ingredients. He will then be able to prepare new dishes and satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy equipment to install his kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, desde hace 4 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de aceites y cambio de cadena de su mototaxi y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Esther, 34, lives with her husband and children in her own house, which is located in a large community in the urban area of Zaña. She has good personal and professional references from her neighbors. The local population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The community is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been offering transport services with her motorcycle taxi for four years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy oil and change the chain on her motorcycle taxi. She will then generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy oil and change the chain on her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Deni is an entrepreneur.  He lives in Ciamis, a semi-urban area about 8 hours from Jakarta.  Deni is married. 

To increase the family income, Deni also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma two months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Deni is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Deni is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Suryaningsih

texts.en:
Suryaningsih is a housewife. She lives in Magelang, a semi-urban area about 15 hours from Jakarta.  Suryaningsih is married. 

To increase the family income, she also works as a dealer.  She joined Ruma two months ago to increase her income and she feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Suryaningsih is starting to process electricity bill payments for her customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase her income.  To provide this new service, she is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help her purchase this printer and offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Les Gédéons Group

texts.fr: La cliente Apoline est une commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’une association  d’affaires «Les Gédéons»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants, dont 4 étudient et les autres sont déjà grands. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers manufacturés et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima  pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari, qui est enseignent dans une école de la place. Elle va acheter, savons de toilette, des cartons de bombons, des biscuits, sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos,  les allumettes, sel iodé etc. Dans l’avenir,  Elle compte construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The client Apoline has been a merchant for the past three years and is member of "Les Gideons" business association. A dynamic 56-year-old entrepreneur, she is married and the mother of 12 children, four of whom are in school and the others are already grown.

She sells a variety of manufactured items and is shareholder of a store. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She started with funds received from her husband, who is a teacher in a local school.

She will buy soap, boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, soap powders, cosmetics, one box of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

In the future, she plans to build her house, educate and feed her children. So she thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy soap, boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oil, soap powders, cosmetics, one box of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Lutfa

texts.en:
Lutfa is a 23-year-old woman from Dhupguri. She lives with her husband Md. Fajlar and two children in the village of Bhemtia. She did not complete her secondary education due to her parents' monetary problems but she is dedicated to providing a good education for her children. They are attending their school regularly and studying in grade I.

Her husband is a farmer who cultivates different types of vegetables and sells them in the local market. Being a housewife, she manages all the household work and then assists her husband with the farming activities. Both of them work hard to take care of their family but are unable to provide sufficient income.

Lutfa wants to extend her helping hands to her husband. She has decided to cultivate jute on her farmland, as it is a most important profitable crop. She thinks this will be a lucrative business because jute fibers are commonly used in making ropes, bags, sacs, canvass, gunny bags, twine, carpets, curtains, twining threads and covers for cotton bales. 

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase jute seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as soon as possible.  She is very hopeful to earn a profit from this new cultivation, which will help her to reach to her goals of giving a decent lifestyle to her family and educating her children to establish them in life. 

Lutfa and her husband are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mujiza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibandja est une commerçante et membre d’une plate forme  d’affaires  «Mujiza», âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère des 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 autres sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse de friperie depuis 2 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché animé de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle démarra ses activités par de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un maitre d’hôtel. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique
texts.en:
The client Kibandja is a merchant and member of the Mujiza business association. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children, of whom three study and the other two are married. She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years.

She displays her merchandise at a busy local market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She started her activities with funds received from her husband, who is a maître d'hôtel.

She will buy one bale of second-hand clothes. In the future, she wants to educate, feed and clothe her children. So she thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system

loans.use: buy one bale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Makimbiliyo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kulenga est une commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires «Makimbiliyo»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 35ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima  pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle va acheter des sacs de riz, huile végétale, braises, tomates, fretins, thé etc. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The client Kulenga has been a merchant for the past three years and is a member of the Makimbiliyo business association. A dynamic 35-year-old entrepreneur, she is married and mother to four children, all in school.

She sells food products. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She started with funds received from her husband, who is also a merchant.

She will buy bags of rice, vegetable oil, charcoal, tomatoes, small fry, tea, etc. In the future, she intends to buy a plot, build a house, educate and feed her children.

So she thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy bags of rice, vegetable oil, charcoal, tomatoes, small fry, tea etc.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a 45-year-old woman.  She lives with her husband Bhanu and two children in the small village of Barmanpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to sixth grade but could not study further due to the financial crisis of her family.  Her husband is a carpenter. One of her children has completed up to grade 10 and the other one is working as a mason due to their monetary problems. 

Manju's husband has no permanent income and it is very difficult to run the family smoothly. So, Manju has been working in animal husbandry for five years. She is a hardworking lady and has the courage to get ahead in life. She keeps the faith in her own ability. She has a milk cow and she sells milk in her neighborhood.

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow and for that, she needs money. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the loan to purchase another cow and she hopes to improve her milk supply business.  It will provide her with a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save for their children’s future. She dreams of investing the profits in the future acquisition of good quality cows.

She is thankful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose Antonio tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, desde hace 3 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 400 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio, 23, lives with his wife and son in their family home in a large community in the urban area of Zaña. The local population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock. The community is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

He has been offering transport services with his motorcycle taxi for three years. He has applied for a loan of 1,400 Peruvian nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi. He will then have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en:
Etidal is 43 years old and a divorced woman. She is responsible for supporting her six children.

To be able to do so, she started a small retail business selling cosmetic products. Later on, she added clothes, shoes, blankets and bags to her business, which grew her profit and enabled her to open her own shop. Now Etidal is a seeking a loan to purchase clothes and more blankets to respond to her customers' requests. She doesn't have enough money to do so, so for that reason she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more timber to expand her business.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is a 45-year-old married woman and together with her husband, is raising three children. She has attended school up to grade seven. She is married to Motaleb who is running his business. They are from a remote village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Sabira is engaged in livestock as an additional source of income for her family.  She started this business a few years back, as she was unable to run her family with her husband's small income. Every day, she gets up early at dawn, does all the household work and then looks after her animal husbandry business. Sabira is a very hardworking lady and has a great dedication to her work with which she will be able to improve her family's well-being and provide a better future for her daughter.
 
Now she is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase another dairy cow with the aim of starting a business of milk products. She hopes that she will earn more profit from this business, as the products (butter. Paneer, curd, and cheese) are in great demand in her present local market. She plans to invest the profits in the future acquisition of more cattle. She also intends to save money for her children’s future as well as to build a pakka (made of bricks) house for her family.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy products supply business.

loans.name: Siddheshwari

texts.en:
Siddheshwari is a 40-year-old married woman from the small village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is a housewife and her husband, aged 52 years, works in agriculture. They have three school-going children who are in grades 6, 7 and 9 respectively. They all live together in their own small kaccha (made of mud and clay) house.  Consequently, the whole family depends on Siddheshwari‘s husband's income.

Her husband works as a farmer and he has been doing this for five years.  He makes a living for the family by working in the field. He has a small farm and he cultivates mainly seasonal vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, carrots etc.  He is the only source of income for the family, but it is very much difficult to bear all the household expenses of a five-member family with his income. So, Siddheshwari and her husband have decided to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.

Siddheshwari is a tenacious woman and she is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family.  She has taken economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supports such as good quality jute seeds, fertilizers etc. to start cultivation. Her long-term goal is to go ahead with this jute cultivation so that when the jute is harvested, it is in abundance.

As a mother, she wishes to strengthen her children's patrimony, support them in their goals, studies and the other necessities that they may be successful and get ahead. In addition to this, she dreams of constructing a concrete house for them to live in.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a 32-year-old woman.  She lives with her husband Ananda and their only daughter in the small village of Barmanpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to seventh grade and could not study further because of the financial crisis of her family. Her husband is associated with a mobile business, selling mobiles in the local area. Their only daughter is young and studies in grade 1.

Suchitra's husband has no permanent income and it is very difficult to run the family smoothly. So, Suchitra has been working in the animal husbandry business for a few years. She is a hardworking lady and has the courage to get ahead in life. She keeps the faith about her own ability. She has a milk cow and she sells milk in her neighborhood.

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow and for that, she needs money. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the loan to purchase another cow and she hopes to improve her milk supply business.  It will provide her with a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save for their daughter's future. She wants to save money to construct a house for them to live in. 

She is thankful for her lenders BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, junto a su hijo en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, desde hace 02 años, su esposa le apoya con la ventad de leche fresca y quesos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 33, lives with his common-law wife and son in the district of Lagunas, a community involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming in the Chiclayo Province which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

For two years, Wilmer has been raising dairy livestock.  His wife helps with sales of fresh milk and cheese.  He has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy balanced animal feed for his livestock in an effort to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic goods to offer to customers.

loans.name: Janet Nataly

texts.es:
Janet Nataly tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 04 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, además su esposa se dedica a las labores de jornalería y contratista de yuca, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales y arreglos de su vivienda que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janet Nataly, 29, lives with her common-law husband and four dependent children.  She lives in the Oyotún District, a rural area whose people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small farm animals from home.  Her husband works as a day laborer and also as a yucca subcontractor.  She has requesed a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and carry out home repairs in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animals and make home repairs.

loans.name: Noviyanto

texts.en:
Noviyanto is a private employee. He lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about eight hours from Jakarta.  Noviyanto is married. 

To increase the family income, Noviyanto also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma six months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Noviyanto is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Noviyanto is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su quinto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que cada una ira recibiendo las capacitaciones correspondientes para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de ellas es la señora Sonia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de manera ambulante, comenta que pese a los problemas que surgen día a día, está luchando y mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con una buena cantidad de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio y quiere poder dar a sus seres queridos todo y que tengan una vida digna.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas group is in its fifth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program, where all promised to work and to help each other to move forward. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which three of the 19 women find themselves below the poverty line. Each one of them will receive corresponding training to be able to improve their living conditions.

One of them is Sonia, who works selling clothes on the street. She says that because of the problems she faces daily, she is fighting and improving every day.

She is applying for this loan to be able to stock up with a good quantity of winter clothing, as it is getting colder and she wants to be able to give her loved ones everything so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing articles to sell.

loans.name: Tamarisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tamarisco  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, que cada una debe capacitarse para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patricia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno., lo cual quiere ir mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace.
Patricia comenta que con su préstamo quiere  comprar gran cantidad de jeans, blusas, y lencerías varias y con ello abaratar los costos para obtener mejor ganancia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Tamarisco group is doing the poverty elimination survey, in which 2 of the 17 women find themselves below the poverty line. Each one must train to be able to improve their own and their families' living conditions.

One of the members is Patricia, who in her survey showed a poverty level inside level one, which she hopes to improve through continued work and effort, by selling clothes.

Patricia says that with her loan she wants to buy a large quantity of jeans, blouses and various lingerie and with this reduce her costs in order to obtain better earnings.

She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving and which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses and lingerie to sell.

loans.name: La Chispa (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la  ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito La Chispa. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse  y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha a servido de mucho para mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Lucia, tiene 32 años  de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres  hijas de años de 15, 14  y 13  años que estudian en colegio. Su marido es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Lucia además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en casa de unos familiares,  este negocio lo comenzó hace 5 meses con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo y a pesar de que su negocio no está muy bien surtido sus ganancias han sido muy buenas y espera con este nuevo crédito surtir mas su negocio, ella trabaja todos los días y sus hijas le ayudan cuando llegan de sus estudios, gracias a sus ganancias ella puede solventar los gastos que sus hijas tienen en sus estudios ya que su marido no gana mucho.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir mas su tienda. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace dos ciclos  y espera seguir por mucho más tiempo ya que le ayudan mucho los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijas tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the members of the communal bank "La Chispa" meet in the capital city of Portoviejo.  They are involved in different business activities such as general commerce, services and others.  When the members found out about all the benefits offered by the institution they decided to join together and form a loan group which has helped them improve their incomes greatly.

One of the members of the group is Lucia who is 32, married and has three daughters, ages 15, 14 and 13 who attend school.  Her husband is a security guard.

Apart from being a great homemaker, Lucia also works in commerce and has a grocery store in the house of one of her relatives.  She started the business five months ago with her first loan through the group.  Despite the fact that the store is not very well stocked, her profits have been very good and she hopes to use the new loan to increase her inventory.  She works every day and her daughters help out when they get home from school.  Thanks to her earnings she has been able to cover her daughters' school expenses, since her husband does not earn much.

Lucia plans to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, canned goods and other products to increase store inventory.  She has been a member of the loan group for two loan cycles and hopes to continue a long time because the loans are very helpful.  Her goal is to give her daughters a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned goods and other basic products.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 50 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Luz is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Luz has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is happy and is just impatient to start her second deal with Kiva, since she liked her first deal very much, and it helped her to develop her business. Anush lives with her family in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. She still rents a stall where she sells great range of household goods, tableware, vases, decanters for juice, toys and pictures; just everything that any housewife would like to have in her kitchen and for her house decoration as well. 

Anush transports the merchandise for her stall from Yerevan wholesale market once a month, with the help of her son. As Ansuh says her business covers the main part of her family needs, since other members of the family has no constant work. 

Anush hopes to have this loan since she wants to refresh and enlarge her stall’s assortment with new and fashionable tableware, nice coffee and tea sets, and she also wants to buy souvenirs to resell.

loans.use: to buy a new and fashionable tableware, nice coffee and tea sets and souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is a 54-year-old married woman. She has three children. For about 4 years she is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she will get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Asia dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en:
Gulsanam is a repeat client of IMON. She is a responsible woman. Gulsanam was born in 1972. She is married and has 3 children. Two of them are non-adults and one of them is an adult. Gulsanam has been busy with agricultural activities for more than 10 years. Gulsanam grows crops on one hectare of land. She is the main food provider for her children because her husband is a migrant and doesn’t send money regularly. 

Gulsanam’s elder son is a student in the first year of courses. Gulsanam is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to pay for her son's tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her son.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa 2 está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien por medio de su humilde trabajo de recicladora, ayuda a su familia. Ella comenta que sale a recolectar productos reciclados de manera ambulante, como ser cartones, aluminio, y demás. Comenta que está muy orgullosa del trabajo que hace, ya que por medio de esto puede dar a su familia lo que necesita, por medio de tu humilde trabajo.
Ramona pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aluminio, cartón, papel y demás, para posteriormente vender y así tener una ganancia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa 2" is in its third cycle of the proverty elimination program.   The women are heads of family who joined together to help their families through their work.

One of the members is Ramona who helps her family through her humble recycling work.  She says she goes out to collect recyclable products such as cardboad, aluminum and other items, and is very proud of her work as it is the source of income for everything the family needs.

Ramona is requesting a loan to buy aluminum, cardboard, paper and other products to sell for a profit.  She is grateful for this opportunity which will allow her to continue expanding in what she does.

loans.use: To buy aluminum, cardboard, paper and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa está en su tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y también forman parte del programa de comités, son mujeres jefas de familia, muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien se dedica a vender ropas de todo tipo de manera ambulante, y que por medio de este trabajo se ha hecho conocida y ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Hoy pide este préstamo ya que necesita surtirse con una mejor variedad de prendas de invierno para poder seguir con su trabajo, y dando una buena variedad a sus clientes.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its third loan cycle of the enterprising women program, and also forms part of the communal bank program. They are women who are the heads of their families, very hardworking and enterprising.

One of the members is Blanca, who works selling all types of clothing on the street. Through this work she has become well known and has improved her own and her family's living conditions.

She is applying for this loan today as she needs to stock up with a better variety of winter clothing in order to continue working and offering a good variety to her customers.

She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving and which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy various winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 32 years old and has 2 children.  Andrea is married and both of her children are in school.

Andrea and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Andrea is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,250 in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Andrea has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. Her plans is to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Andrea can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby bath tubs, baby power and baby clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 27-year-old married woman, and has two sons. She has a small food market in her neighborhood that she has been running for two years to support her husband in covering their children's needs. 

Ibtisam is now requesting a youth loan, which she will use to stock her food market with more food products and home detergents to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase food products and home detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Poty Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes Poty está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para que por medio de ello puedan ayudar a sus familias e ir superando su línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, quien se destaca por ser una persona muy jovial, y servicial, quien a través de su trabajo que consiste en la venta de comidas, y sumado a su  esfuerzo viene saliendo adelante. Está luchando para poder crecer y dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Las Mercedes Poty are doing the poverty elimination survey, to be able to help their families and get above the poverty line through this.

One of the members is Mariela, who stands out for being a very cheerful and helpful person, who is moving forward due to her effort and her work selling food. She is fighting to be able to grow and give her family everything that she couldn't have.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various supplies to make food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods and more. In this way she hopes to continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods and more to be able to make and sell food.

loans.name: Mary Liliana

texts.es:
Mary Liliana tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, cerdos, desde hace 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposo comercializan los animales en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales para engordar y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mary Liliana is 39 years old; she is married and lives with her family in this same district of Oyotún, a rural area, where its people make their living in farming, commerce and livestock: it is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.

Mary Liliana has been making her living for the last ten years rearing and selling animals such as roosters, chicken, hens, ducks and pigs, with the help of her husband they sell the animals in the market of their area. Mary Liliana is seeking a loan for 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a larger volume of animals to fatten up and offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of animals for fattening up.

loans.name: Aarón

texts.es:
El joven Aarón, es padre de tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar y  labora como comerciante en una tienda de ropa ubicada en la ciudad de león, desempaña esta labor desde hace 6 años, inicia sus labores 08:30 am  finalizando  a las 05:30 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a sábado,  el  realiza esta labor para el sustento de su hogar.   

El joven Aarón solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, shores, zapatos, entre otros productos, esto le permitirá incrementar su clientela y así poder aumentar su capital de trabajo al igual que su inventario con productos nuevos y de mejor calidad para su apreciable clientela, a la vez  le permitirá mejor la calidad de vida de él como de su familia.
texts.en:
The young Aarón is father to three children, two of whom are of school age, and Aarón works as a sales person in a clothes store located in the city of León. He has been performing this work for the last six years and starts work at 8:30 am and finishes at 5:30 pm from Monday to Saturday. He does this job to support his household.

Aarón is seeking a loan from Ceprodel which he used to buy trousers, t-shirts, shorts and shoes among other products. This will allow him to increase his customer base and therein grow his working capital as well as give his inventory new products of better quality for his sizeable clientele. At the same time, it will enable him to improve both his own quality of life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, shorts, shoes and so on.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, age 42, helps to support her family by offering tailoring services to her neighbors and members of her local community. She is the hard-working mother of seven children. She has been engaged in this work for many years and is well-versed in stitching techniques. She earns enough to help her family lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Abida has requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with buttons, laces, and packs of zippers. This investment will help her to meet with the increasing demand of her customers. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her increased revenues to deal with the family's personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with buttons, laces, and packs of zippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, maintenance and so on.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, age 31, buys and sells animals to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for many years. She purchases calves and baby goats, raises them, and then offers them for sale near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha, a religious event in Muslim countries. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Goundation. She has now requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase a calf and a baby goat. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.  

Kishwar hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to offer a good, high-quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and a baby goat to raise

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat, age 34, sells dry fruit and nuts to earn an income. She has been helping her husband to support their five children in this way for many years. In this way, she is better able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. She is contentedly operating her business for the sake of her family, who appreciate and respect her for her efforts.

Due to lack of availability of funds, Ishrat is currently unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Ishrat has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase peanuts, walnuts, and almonds. This investment will help her to inflate her sales. 

Ishrat dreams of providing a good lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, walnuts, and almonds to offer for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil and biscuits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana, age 42, is a vigorous lady. She has been running a boutique business for many years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market and, after doing embroidery, she sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Shabana is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth, sequins and beads with spools of thread to inflate her sales. She is in her 8th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth, sequins and beads with spools of thread.

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon lives in a rural area. He is married and has 2 children. He is a very hardworking man. Islomjon is a welder. Islomjon offers services to the local people.

He lives with his family in an old house. Little by little, he is building a new house for his family. He wants to live in a comfortable and new house. Islomjon is building his house by his own hands; his wife helps him.

Islomjon now needs to financial support because he wants to finish a lot of the building work before the winter season. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cement, bricks, etc. for building a new house. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, etc. for building a new house

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her area. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Sajida requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all of her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and maize flour

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Con apenas 21 años, Miguel ya tiene experiencia en el trabajo agropecuario en el zona rural del municipio de Tierra Alta, Córdoba. Estas habilidades las fue adquiriendo gracias al trabajo constante y las enseñanzas de su padre quien lo preparo para enfrentar la vida.
El trabaja en una parcela de su familia y tiene cultivos de plátano y yuca que atiende todos los días para aprovechar las cosechas y vender sus productos en la plaza de mercado del municipio.
Es un joven muy trabajador y dedicado, con capacidad para aprender rápidamente. Manifiesta mucho entusiasmo al poder obtener un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y otros productos para la preparación de sus tierras.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener unos cultivos más grandes y obtener los recursos suficientes para costearse los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
At only 21 years old,  Miguel already has experience in farming and livestock work in the rural area of the town of  Tierra Alta, Córdoba. He acquired these abilities thanks to constant work and the teachings of his father, who prepared him to face life. 

He works on family land and has plantain and yucca crops that he cares for every day so he can harvest them and sell the products in the market in his town. He is a very hardworking and dedicated young man with the ability to learn quickly. He shows a lot of enthusiasm about getting a loan to buy fertilizer and other products to prepare the soil. His biggest dream is to have bigger crops and to obtain enough resources to pay for his college education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural and livestock materials.

loans.name: Begum  Mai

texts.en: Begum Mai is a 41-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past twelve years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband works on daily wages but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She is a mother of five children; all of whom are in school. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her town. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nzawze

texts.en:
Nzawze is a married woman who has been blessed with eight children, five of whom are in school. She lives at her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nzawze has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 34-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and ribbons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and ribbons

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Safia is a married woman. Ten years ago, she started a business selling milk with her husband. She has three buffaloes for milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together to support their family.

Safia has six children: four of whom are in school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. For the improvement of her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Djiguitougou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam1 de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habits, Ustensiles de cuisine, Condiments, Bois et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur  cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Sali  est un membre du groupe Djiguitougou, debout devant, les deux mains sur les bois de chauffe qu’elle vend. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de bois de chauffe dans les brousses en qualité et en quantité au fur et à mesure  qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguitougou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sali compte réaliser  95 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguitougou is a group of women from the Darsalam 1 district in the town of Koutiala. The women know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 38 years of age and have at least four children each.

This group of women buy and sell products such as clothing, kitchen utensils, condiments, wood and others. In order to expand their businesses the members joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and they are on their fifth group loan.

Sali, who is a member of the Djiguitougou group, is standing at the front of the photo with her two hands on the firewood that she sells. She is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient number of loads of good quality firewood from the scrubland to be able to sell as and when she needs to on a retail basis.to a mixed customer base. 

While the other members of the Djiguitougou group expect to make an average profit of 80,000FCFA each during the cycle, Sali expects to make 95,000FCFA. Apart from repaying their loans, the women use part of their income to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses. They would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stocks do not run too low.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy saltwater fish.

loans.name: Anastas

texts.en:
Anastas lives with his wife and his retired parents in the village of Davit Bek in the Syunik region. He is the father of three sons, who are married and live separately with their families. Anastas has received a vocational education and is a professional welder, but for many years he has earned an income from offering a regional taxi services in his own car. Anastas also runs a family farming business. He raises wheat on his own plot of land. He also keeps three beehives, two cows, and 32 chickens. His wife helps him by selling the milk, meat, eggs, and other goods from their farm.

Anastas is requesting this loan in order to buy diesel fuel as well as to rent equipment and organize hay mowing activities. His agricultural efforts demand much time and effort, but with the help of Kiva lenders, Anastas has great hopes for improving his family's standard of living through this business.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel as well as to rent equipment and organize hay mowing activities

loans.name: Anastanzia

texts.en: Anastanzia appreciates for her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two heifers with which she will once again start a meat carving business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 49 años de edad, solo estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ha procreado 5 hijos en esta relación los cuales tres de ellos están en la escuela, sus hijos y una nieta son los únicos que dependen de Ana.

Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en ocasiones le ayuda al esposo en la agricultura, la actividad la realiza desde hace 25 años, decidieron trabajar en la agricultura para sacar adelante a sus hijos, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y viaja a pie, en el trabajo solo se involucran dos hijos mayores, y lo realizan de 6:00 a 11:00 de la mañana.
 
Este préstamo solicitado en CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar un saco de abono que le hace falta para terminar de regarle a su cultivo esto le ayudará amucho ya que por medio de los prestamos tienen como comprar el abono y así la milpa tendrá mejor desarrollo y le dará más cultivos y ganancias.

Sus sueños son seguir cultivando la tierra junto a su esposo y apoyarlo en lo que sea necesario para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old. She only went to school through the third grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has 5 children from this relationship and three of them are in school. Her children and a granddaughter are her only dependents.

Ana takes care of the home and on occasions she helps her husband with the farming. She has done this activity for 25 years. They decided to work in agriculture to get their children ahead. The work is 15 minutes away on foot. Only her two oldest children are involved in the work, and they work from 6:00 until 11:00 in the morning.
 
The loan she has asked CrediCampo for is needed to buy a sack of fertilizer. She needs it to finish fertilizing her crop. This will help her a lot because with the loans they can buy fertilizer and the corn will grow better and bring in more harvest and earnings.  

Her dream is to keep working the land with her husband and helping him with whatever he needs so that her children will lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy a sack of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a vigorous 34-year-old lady; she has been sewing clothes for the past six years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has four children, and she is motivated to provide her family with a good standard of living. Currently, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use the loan proceeds to buy more spools of thread in various colors, together with packets of laces, zippers and buttons. The loan will help her meet the demand from her customers on time. She shared her dream, of running a training center for girls in her town.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, together with packets of laces, zippers and buttons, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. At present, she has one cow in milk and sells its milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She earns a good amount of income to cover her household expenditures. In order to make huge profits, Amina applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy an additional cow to serve more customers. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. This will be her third loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy one additional cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 40-year-old married woman. Six years ago, she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys a variety of fabrics in various colors and designs in the market at wholesale prices and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is applying for a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of good quality cloth in various colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of the living conditions of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality fabric in various colors and designs for her business.

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakina

texts.en: Ghulam Sakina is a 44-year-old, married woman and mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated a business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income.  With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shabnum

texts.en: Shabnum has been running a business manufacturing hand-made fans for many years. She is very famous in her circle for providing fancy fans. In this way she earns a good amount of income to support her household expenses. For meeting the increasing demands of her customers she needs to purchase bamboo material, threads, and mirrors for embellishments. For this reason she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle and has good credit history. She expects a boost in her earnings from larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo material, threads, and mirrors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, pearly, iron, nails, sand and manpower.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building material such as iron corrugate sheets, sand, nails, and cement in order to build a house for his family

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children, four of which go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a a beauty saloon . She operates her business on a retail basis. She works three days a week .She has been in this business for the last five years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy weaves, relaxers and braids. 

Christine's major challenge is electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked beauty salon. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy relaxers, braids, weaves and shampoo.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
This is Luvuno. She runs a fruit and vegetable business.  Previously she accessed a loan that was a big help fo her personally, for her household and business.

Luvuno is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, potatoes to sell.. 

She appreciates Kiva  for their financial support. 

Luvuno looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is a vigorous 32-year-old lady who has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use the loan proceeds to buy more spools of thread in various colors, together with packets of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to sew up more dresses on time and to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, together with packets of laces, zippers and buttons, for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells charcoal to earn an income. She sells charcoal from her home to her neighbors and fellow villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is unmarried, has no children, and lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Agnes joined Yehu in order to receive financial support for her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal was born in 1970. She is married and a mother of three girls. Nawal has been supporting her husband in paying their household fees for two years by selling clothes and blankets. Now she is seeking a loan to expand the amount of her products so that she will raise her profit and be able to provide her daughters with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 39 year old married woman. She runs a successful general store at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field.  

Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Salma is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.  

She wants to grow her business and requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

Salma is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Fehmida

texts.en:
Fehmida is 52 years old, married woman who has four children.  

She is very talented and excels at making envelopes.  Fehmida makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them at the local market. 


Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet the family's needs alone so her income helps in providing for the household.

To help Fehmida continue her business she is requesting a loan of 40, 000 PKR to buy bundles of good quality paper, packs of glue and a cutter to increase her sales. 

Fehmida expects an increase in her income as she expands.  She wishes to use her profits to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper, packs of glue and a cutter.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, a 37-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at her to provide for her family.  

She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews items together and sells her finished products to people whol live near her.  

She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

To improve her business, Nazia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. 

With a good credit history, this will be Nazia's third loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Daliribindenpora - Demonaayili Group

texts.en:
Balchisu is a 35-year-old, married woman living with her husband and five children in Bimonayili, a community in Northern Ghana. Balchisu is the third person in the front row with her hands on the shea nuts from the left in the group photo. Their group is called Daliribindenpora - Demonaayili.

All the members of the group are involved in the business of picking and processing shea nuts into shea butter. They have been in the business for the past fifteen years. They process high premium shea butter, which is partially sold to aggregators and exported to the European and US markets. Balchisu also sells the butter to customers in Ghana. The group is therefore requesting a loan of GHS 7,900 and Balchisu would use her potion of the loan to buy nine bags of shea nuts for processing into shea butter.

Balchisu hopes to increase her income so as to support her family to have regular food to eat, buy educational materials for her children and repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy nine bags of shea nuts for processing into shea butter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, iron rods, nails, sand, and cement for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with four children and all of them go to school. She takes care of  additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis . She works six days a week .She has been in this business for the last four years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy to buy sweet potatoes, cooking oil, flour, beans and bunches of green bananas. Her major challenge includes transportation and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a fridge for her restaurant.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, beans, sweet potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy material to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
