Her family was growing, and her economic situation was somewhat difficult, which is why she had the idea of acquiring an automobile to use for transporting the public, with the hope that her children would be able to run it someday. Although their businesses are prospering, Marcela and her children haven’t finished paying for their automobile; this is preventing them from fully devoting themselves to the art of weaving, and they are losing clientele and sales. 

Marcela’s oldest son is 15 years old, and he wants to learn to drive the automobile so that they can stop paying the driver that they hired, and the two younger children weave the sheep and alpaca wool that their mother buys from a neighboring community of the high plateau. This is why Marcela is seeking the loan: to finish paying for her vehicle and to purchase sheep and alpaca wool.

loans.use: to finish paying for her vehicle and to purchase sheep and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina de 23 años de edad, es madre de una niña de seis años quien estudia primer grado en la escuela de la comunidad y a quien tiene que ir a dejar a estudiar de lunes a viernes, tiene que caminar 1 km cada día y además ir a traerla por la mediodía. Reina estudio hasta el bachillerato, gracias al apoyo de sus padres se graduó en el 2009, tiene otros tres hermanos con quienes se ha crecido, se acompañó hace cuatro años, su esposo trabaja de motorista en la ciudad, y siempre está pendiente de la familia.	
Reina siempre ha sido una mujer emprendedora, desde pequeña ayudaba a sus padres a vender pan en la comunidad y a los oficios del hogar.
Hace un año sus padres y hermanos la motivaron para que iniciara su propio negocio, su esposo la apoyo y también le dio $200 para poner una pequeña tienda en la comunidad, ya que solo hay una y está bastante retirada de la zona más poblada, fue así como emprendió su pequeño negocio donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta básica entre otros. Antes,  trabajo por dos años en la construcción de la carretera que pasa por su comunidad y con ello ayudaba a sus padres y a su hija.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo para comprar una vitrina para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y  un estante donde pondrá productos de la canasta básica, y comprara mercadería. Lo que le permitirá tener  más productos que vender y por ende obtener mayores ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a su hija, y apoyar a su familia.
Reina sueña con apoyar a su hija para que salga adelante con los estudios y logre culminar una carrera en la universidad. Además, quiere incrementar su pequeño negocio para lo que planea ahorrar para adquirir productos de las ganancias que obtiene de la tienda.
texts.en:
Reina is 23 years old and the mother of a six year old daughter who is a first grade student in the community school. She leaves her to study Monday through Friday, walking 1 kilometer each day and back to get her at noon. Reina studied through high school and thanks to the support of her parents she graduated in 2009. She grew up with three siblings, married four years ago, and her husband works as a driver in the city and is always thinking of the family.

Reina has always been an enterprising woman. Since she was young she helped her parents sell bread in the community and did household chores. A year ago her parents and siblings encouraged her to start her own business. Her husband supported her and also gave her $200 to open a small community store, since there is only one and it is far away from the more populated area. So this is how she opened her small business where she offers her customers basic stables and more. Previously she worked in the construction of a road that passed through her community and was able therefore to help her parents and her daughter.

She is asking for a loan from CrediCampo to buy a display case to have more products to offer her customers and a shelf where she will put basic staples, and to buy merchandise, permitting her to have more products to sell resulting in more income to bring up her daughter and support her family.

Reina dreams of supporting her daughter throughout her studies successfully ending in a university degree. She also wants to expand her small business planning to save so she can buy merchandise from the earnings she gets from the store.

loans.use: to buy a showcase so she can have more products to offer her customers and a shelf where she can put basic staples, and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wooden ceiling supporting poles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story:

Maricela is 32 years old. She is married to Saul, and they have two sons, ages 13 and 11. She works selling jewelry, and the income that she earns is to help with the family’s expenses. 

She started working with a lady ten years ago, and she enjoyed the work. Two years ago, she became independent and started selling jewelry outside her home, and later in some flea markets in Mexico City.

Maricela is asking for the loan to buy newer products and offer more variety to her clients. She believes that after selling the jewelry, she will be able to pay the loan and get a 50% profit.

loans.use: to buy new jewelry models and offer more product variety to her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Camila es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, como medio de subsistencia. Tiene tres hijos, que ya son independientes a ella, y le apoyan en lo que pueden en los gastos del hogar. Camila a través de varios créditos ha ido invirtiendo en mercadería para su negocio y así poder sacarlo adelante. El crédito solicitado esta vez es también para inversión en su negocio, lo que usará para comprar ropa, cosméticos Avon y Zermat, y así poder mantener variedad de productos para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en: Camila is a small merchant who sells cosmetics and clothing as a means of earning a living. She has three children who are already independent adults, and support her however they can with the household expenses. Camila has invested previous loans in merchandise for her business so that she could get ahead. The loan she is requesting this time is to invest in her business. She will use it to buy clothing and Avon and Zermat cosmetics, therefore allowing her to have a more varied product line to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and new clothing for her business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes junto a sus dos hijos. Siempre se ha dedicado al negocio. Lleva mas de 11 años de tener su negocio de venta de comidas y golosinas, vende almuerzos, desayunos, baleadas, tacos, pastelitos, refrescos, churros, galletas etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ella ha invertido ya tres prestamos anteriores, el actual que solicita es por 25,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas como ser carnes, condimentos, harina, arroz, verduras, queso, embutidos, y también refrescos para vender, con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos. El plan que tiene es seguir con el negocio para la manutención y la educación de sus hijos y mejorar el nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María, 43, is single due to widowhood. She lives in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes, with her two children. She has always been a businesswoman. She has had a food and snack business for more than eleven years. She sells lunches, breakfasts, baleadas (flour tortilla filled with eggs, cheese and beans), tacos, turnovers, soft drinks, fritters, cookies, etc. 

She has already had three previous loans. Currently she is asking for 25,000 Lempiras and she will invest it in the purchase of supplies to use making meals such as meat, spices, flour, rice, vegetables, cheese, sausage, and soft drinks to sell in order to sell and earn more. Her goal is to continue in business in order to bring up and educate her children and improve the level of life for the family.

loans.use: yo buy supplies such as meat, spices, flour, rice, vegetables, cheese, sausage, and also soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
Armida de 50 años de edad, no estudio de debido a que no tuvo la oportunidad, ya que la zona donde vivía con sus padres en ese entonces era bastante afectada por la guerra civil que sufría el país en esos momentos,  sus padres trabajaban en la siembra de maíz y frijoles y ella junto con sus hermanas le ayudaban cada día para tener el alimento. Se casó hace 25 años y su esposo trabaja en la apicultura negocio en el cual posee mucha experiencia y le gusta mucho, es madre de un hijo quien también  trabaja de ayudante en un taller mecánico.	
Armida tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta básica desde hace 26 años cuando se casó emprendió su pequeño negocio para apoyar a su esposo y juntos luchar para obtener ingresos económicos para tener una buena calidad de vida. Además, ayuda a su esposo a vender miel en su casa de habitación, negocio que también conoce muy bien y está a cargo de su comercialización.
Hace cuatro años también que se dedica a la venta de productos de lencería de donde también obtiene ingresos para la familia.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo,  para comprar 3 colmenas y también necesita comprar más productos de la canasta básica para ofrecer a sus clientes en la comunidad. Así podrá contar con más ingresos económicos  para su familia.
Armida sueña con aumentar poco a poco sus colmenas para tener mayor producción de miel y vender más productos, también quiere en el futuro con su esposo tener su propio nombre comercial en el mercado.
Además quiere crecer en su tienda para tener mayores productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que en la comunidad donde reside no hay muchos negocios, lo que le permitiría tener más fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Armida is 50 years old. She did not go to school because she didn't have the opportunity; back then, the area where she lived with her parents was quite affected by the civil war suffered by her country at that time. Her parents worked in corn and bean farming and she, along with her sisters, helped them every day in order to have food. She married 25 years ago and her husband works in beekeeping, a business in which he has a great deal of experience and which he really likes. She is the mother of one son who also works as an assistant in a mechanic's shop.

Armida has had a small general store for 26 years. When she was getting married, she started her small business to support her husband and strive with him to earn economic income in order to have a good quality of life. In addition, she helps her husband sell honey from their house, a business that she also knows very well; she is in charge of sales.

For four years, she has also sold lingerie, earning additional income for her family. 

She is requesting a loan from CrediCampo in order to buy three beehives. She also needs to buy more everyday household staples to offer to her customers in the community. That way, she will be able to have more economic income for her family.

Armida dreams of increasing their beehives little by little in order to have greater honey production and sell more products. She also wants for her husband to have his own commercial brand in the market. 

In addition, she wants to expand her shop to have more products to offer to her customers, since in the community where she lives, there are not many stores; that would enable her to have more sources of income.

loans.use: to purchase three beehives. She also needs to buy more everyday household staples to offer her customers in the community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат замужняя женщина в возрасте 44 лет. Она многодетная мать, у которой четверо сыновей и двое дочерей. Старший сын женат и живет с женой у родителей. Муж Шарофат  с двумя средними сыновьями находится в данное время в России на заработках. Младший сын и дочери учатся в школе. Сама Шарофат и ее старший сын с женой занимаются животноводством. Они уже 6 лет выращивают маленьких телят для продажи. Одновременно они еще занимаются земледелием. Шарофат просит кредит для расширения животноводческого хозяйства. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a married woman of the age of 44 years. She is the mother of many children; four sons and two daughters. The eldest son is married and lives with his wife and children. Sharofat's husband and two of her sons are currently in Russia as migrant workers. The youngest son and the daughters go to school. 

Sharofat, her eldest son and his wife work with livestock breeding. They have been breeding young calves for sale for six years already. They are also working with field crop cultivation in parallel. Sharofat requests a loan to expand the livestock breeding business. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase calves to develop her business

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 37-летняя сельская женщина района Яван. Она активная, трудолюбивая и добропорядочная женщина. У нее трое сыновей и двое дочерей. Она живет с мужем, детьми и со свекровью. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Зулайхо занимается растениеводством в течение 15 лет. Она сейчас с помощью мужа и детей занимается сбором урожая пшеницы и планирует на этих землях провести очередной посев. Однако для купли качественных семян и минеральных удобрений ее собственных средств не хватает. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. С полученной прибыли Зулайхо хочет провести маленький ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Zulayho is a 37 years old village woman from the Yavan region. She is active, hard-working and respectable woman. She has three sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband, children and mother-in-law. Her husband works as a dekhan farmer. 

Zulayho has worked with field crop cultivation for a period of 15 years. With the help of her husband and children she is currently harvesting wheat, and plans to sow new crops on this land. However she does not have enough money to purchase quality seeds and mineral fertilizers. Therefore she applied for a loan. Zulayho would like to do small repairs to her home through the income received.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса — из Берегово. Она 15 лет занимается бизнесом, торгуя нижним бельем и купальниками на местном рынке, а также на разных рынках области. Не так давно семья Ларисы купила машину для постоянных разъездов и мобильной торговли, средств на товар осталось мало, а они нужны, чтобы держать бизнес на уровне. 
Сумму в 30 000 гривен Лариса планирует вложить в приобретение дополнительной партии товара, а именно разноплановых сплошных и раздельных купальников и мужских плавок. Лариса всеми силами стремиться развивать свое дело и постепенно поднимать его на все более высокий уровень.
texts.en:
Larisa is from Beregovo. She has had a business for 15 years, selling underwear and swimwear at the local market and other markets in the region. Not long ago, Larisa's family bought a vehicle for repeating trips and mobile sales. They were left with little money for goods, which they need to keep the business running. 

Larisa plans to invest the amount of 30,000 hryvnia in purchasing an additional batch of goods, specifically different swimsuits, bikinis and swimming trunks. Larisa strives to develop her business and step by step lift it to the highest level of quality.

loans.use: to purchase swimwear for selling

loans.name: Iris Yesenia

texts.es:
Iris de 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 meses, estudio hasta su nivel superior, se graduó hace siete años, vivió por más de quince años en la capital del país donde estudio y trabajo para sostenerse en el estudio.
Vive solo con sus abuelos, desde pequeña y han sido ellos quienes la han crecido y apoyado hasta este momento. Ella ahora está pendiente de sus abuelos, su hija y una sobrina.

iris trabajo por cuatro años en la capital del país, de ordenanza para sostener su estudio, luego hace cinco años se vino a su pueblo natal con su familia, debido a la situación delincuencial que azota al país, gracias a su esmero logro obtener un trabajo de promotora de salud y tiene cuatro años de trabajar, de lunes a viernes generalmente, también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de oro y enchape, por las tardes luego de que sale del trabajo, de donde además obtiene ingresos para su familia. Para ir a su trabajo tiene que caminar por media hora debido a los escases de transporte en la zona.

Iris solicita el crédito en la institución, ya que necesita cancelar $500 de la mano de obra que le ayudo a construir su vivienda, y aunque no la ha concluido pero tiene lo principal para llevar a su familia al nuevo hogar,  donde está residiendo actualmente es alquilado.

Lo demás del crédito lo necesita para la compra de mercadería para su negocio  como oro y enchape y así incrementar sus productos para obtener ingresos que le permitan ir creciendo poco a poco en el negocio.
Iris sueña con ver terminada su casa y así tener un lugar más cómodo donde vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 27 years old. She is the single mother of a 6-month-old girl. She studied as long as she could and graduated 7 years ago. She lived and studied in the nation's capital for more than 15 years and worked to support herself while she was studying.

She lives with her grandparents, her daughter, and her niece. Iris worked for 4 years in the capital to support herself when she was studying. Five years ago, she came to her hometown with her family due to the crime in the country. 

Thanks to her hard work, she was able to get a job as a health promoter and has been working in that position four 4 years. She works from Monday through Friday. She also has a small business where she sells gold and veneers. When she leaves work in the afternoons, she works there to earn additional income for her family. To get to work, she has to walk thirty minutes due to the lack of public transportation in the area.

Iris requests a loan from the institution because she needs $500 to pay a worker who helped to build her house and has not yet finished; however, she has the principal in order to take her family to the new home. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase merchandise like gold and veneers for her business in order to increase her products and earn more money, which will allow her to grow her business little by little.

Iris dreams of finishing her home so that she can have a more comfortable home in which to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to pay $500 to the worker who helped her to build her home, and to purchase gold and veneer for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales dos están a cargo de ella. Junto a su esposo habitan en un barrio de la capital. Su esposo trabaja en una zona franca y apoya en los gastos del hogar. Rosario por la necesidad de buscar más ingresos para su familia, empezó un negocio de venta de productos lácteos, como queso, crema, cuajada. Deses invertir más capital a su inventario, es por eso que el crédito solicitada será usado para la compra de estos productos, y así poder generar más ganancias para su familia. Entre sus planes está poder mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario has 3 children, two of whom are still in her care. She lives in a neighborhood in the capital with her husband. Her husband works in a free trade zone and contributes to household expenses. 

In order to earn more money for her family, Rosario started a business where she sells dairy products like cheese, cream, and cheese curds. She would like to invest more money in her inventory, so she requested a loan that she will use to purchase these products so that she can earn more money for her family. Her plans include improving her home so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Savriya

texts.ru: Саврия 46-летняя жительница городка Вахдат начинает новый бизнес. Ее интересует откорм и продажа крупнорогатого скота. В новом бизнесе ей будет помогать семья. Саврия замужем и имеет двух сыновей и дочь, которые учатся в ВУЗе. Саврия сама нигде не работает. Но сейчас она поставила перед собой цель начать животноводческий бизнес. Она считает это прибыльным бизнесом, с помощью чего она сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Но для реализации ее планов она нуждается в кредите. За счет кредита Саврия хочет приобрести несколько голов крупнорогатых скотин и начать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Savriya, a 46 years old resident of the city of Vahdat, is starting a new business. She is interested in fattening and reselling cattle. Her family will help her with the new business. Savriya is married and has two sons and one daughter, who are all studying at the university. 

Savriya does not work, however currently she has set herself the goal of starting a cattle breeding business. She thinks this is a profitable business, and that through it she will be able ti improve the family's financial situation. However, to realize her plans she needs a loan. 

Savriya would like to use the loan to purchase cattle and start her own business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to start a business

loans.name: Havasmoh

texts.ru: Хавасмох родилась в 1975 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Хавасмох очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она более 18 лет занимается производством и продажей лепешек. Хавасмох имеет в этой сфере большого опыта. Она продает лепешки на местном рынке. Она введен бизнес самостоятельно. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать свой бизнес. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки муки, дров для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Havasmoh was born in 1975. She is married and raising three children. Her children are not yet adults. 

Havasmoh is a very hardworking woman. She has worked with making and selling flatbread for more than 18 years. Havasmoh has great experience in this area. She sells the flatbread at the local market. She manages the business on her own. Her husband works with growing field crops. 

Havasmoh would like to increase her working capital and develop her business. With this aim she requests a loan of the amount of 2,000 somoni to purchase flour and wood for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy flour and wood for increasing working capital

loans.name: Oyniso

texts.ru: Ойнисо в своем районе Джиликуль занимается выпечкой уже более 15 лет. Она профессионал своего дела. Ойнисо занимается выпечкой и продажей самбусы - национального пирожка с начинкой. Это семейный бизнес. Вместе с Ойнисо в ее пекарне работают муж и сыновья. У Ойнисо пятеро сыновей в возрасте от 7 до 23 лет. В районе их семью все знают и у них имеются свои постоянные клиенты. Когда у их жителей бывает свадьба или какое-либо другое мероприятие, то они заказывают самбусу у Ойнисо. Сейчас Ойнисо имеет большой заказ и ей необходимо закупить продукты. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, на сумму которого она собирается приобрести муку, маргарин и фарш. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Oyniso has worked with baking, in her region of Jilikul, for more than 15 years already. She is professional in her work. Oyniso works with baking and selling sambusa - filled pies, the national dish. Her husband and sons also work with her at the bakery.

 Oyniso has five children between the ages of 7 and 23. Everyone in the region knows their family and they have returning customers. When the residents hold weddings or other events, they order sambusa from Oyniso. 

Currently Oyniso has a large order and she needs to purchase gods. With this aim she requests a loan, which she will use to purchase flour, butter and mincemeat. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter and mincemeat for baking sambusa (filled pies)

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 42 años de edad,  es madre soltera de un hijo, no estudio debido a la situación económica de sus padres.
Vive con su hijo y dos sobrinos menores a quienes les apoya,  porque su madre vive en estados unidos.
Lucia por años tiene un negocio de tortillas, el cual se ha dedicado debido a la situación económica que tuvo que crecer a su hijo sola,  el negocio lo tiene en su casa el horario es de 5:00 A.M a 1.00 PM de la tarde.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar por mayor maíz y leña suficiente, puesto que su hijo va creciendo y requiere más gastos de esa forma la necesidad quedara satisfecha.
Lucia el sueño que tiene es que su hijo viva en mejores condiciones y estudie para que en el futuro sea profesional y le ayude a ella ,las ganancias de sus ventas las utilizara para cancelar la cuota y comprar lo necesario para ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old. She is the single mother of a son. She did not attend school due to the financial circumstances of her parents. She lives with her son, and two younger nephews supporting them because their mother lives in the United States.

Lucia has had a business selling tortillas for years, and has been dedicated to it because of the financial situation of having to bring up her son. She operates her business from home from 5:00AM until 1:00PM in the afternoon. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy corn at wholesale and enough firewood, since her son is growing and his needs require capital and this is how she will provide it. 

Lucia’s dream is to provide better living conditions for her son and she hopes that he will become a professional in the future and help her. The profits from her sales will be used to pay off the loan and to buy necessities for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and sufficient firewood, since her son is growing and has needs which she pays for and this is how she earns a living to satisfy household expenses

loans.name: Ruth Noemy

texts.es:
Ruth de 26 años de edad, soltera, estudio hasta el bachillerato en el año 2007, en el instituto más cercano y tenía que viajar de lunes a viernes por las mañanas a las cinco y media de la mañana para llegar al centro de estudio, que le quedaba a media hora en transporte urbano.
Vive con sus padres y otros dos hermanos menores a quienes les apoya en los estudios. Ruth trabaja en un consultorio médico desde hace seis años, es su primera experiencia laboral, desde que se graduó en el instituto, antes trabajaba cuidando a una niña después que salía de estudiar, para ganar ingresos económicos que le ayudaran a sostenerse en los estudios.
Viaja de lunes a sábados, tiene que viajar durante media hora en el bus, para llegar al lugar donde labora. Se decidió a trabajar pues no podía seguir la universidad y además tenía que ayudar a sus padres y hermanos en el sostenimiento familiar.
Los días domingos que tiene libre en el trabajo apoya a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar.
Ruth solicita un crédito en credicampo, porque necesita cancelar una cama que compro para su madre y también necesita comprar zapatos y uniformes para sus dos hermanos menores que están estudiando. El crédito le ayudara a que su madre duerma en mejores condiciones y que sus hermanos puedan tener sus uniformes para ir a la escuela.
Ruth sueña con construir una habitación donde vivir y así ir haciéndose de sus propias cosas para ir cumpliendo sus metas en la vida.
Además pretende estudiar en la universidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old, single, and graduated from high school in 2007. She studied at the closest institution, but she had to travel from Mondays through Fridays at 5:30 in the morning to arrive at school, which is located 30 minutes away from her home by public transportation.

She lives with her parents and two young brothers, whom she supports in their studies. Ruth has worked in a medical clinic for the past 6 years. This is her first job since graduating from school. Before, she cared for a young girl before attending school in order to earn money that helped to support her studies.

She travels from Monday through Saturday and has to travel thirty minutes by bus to arrive at work. She decided to work because she could not attend university and she needed to help to support her parents and brothers. On Sundays, she helps her mother with household chores.

Ruth requests the loan from Credicampo because she needs to pay for a bed that she purchased for her mother and she also needs to purchase shoes and uniforms for her two young brothers who are in school. The loan will help her mother to sleep better and will ensure that her brothers have their school uniforms.

Ruth dreams of building a room in which to live so that she can continue doing things to achieve her goals in life. She would also like to attend university in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a bed that she purchased for her mother, and to purchase shoes and uniforms for her two young, school-aged brothers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees and room and board costs.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru:
Зайнура разведена с одним ребенком на руках. Она сейчас живет с бабушкой и маленькой дочерью в районе Пяндж. Ей 25 лет. Зайнура собственным трудом зарабатывает на жизнь. Она на рынке занимается продажей детской одежды. Этот бизнес она начала три года назад. Зайнура приветливая продавщица и старается обслуживать клиентов качественно. 
Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Зайнура запрашивает кредит. Она на сумму кредита собирается привезти сезонный товар, а именно летнюю детскую одежду. Зайнура надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zaynura is divorced and taking care of one child. She currently lives with her grandmother and her little daughter in the region of Pyandj. She is 25 years old. Zaynura earns money for living through her own work. She works with selling children's clothing at the market. She started this business three years ago. 

Zaynura is a friendly saleswoman who strives to serve customers efficiently. In order to increase her turnover, Zaynura requests a loan. She has decided to purchase seasonal goods for the loan amount, and specifically children's summer clothing. Zaynura hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase children's summer clothes for selling

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel estudio hasta segundo grado en la comunidad, es el mayor de los otros seis hermanos que tiene, y tuvo que abandonar el estudio debido a que su padre murió y fue él quien tenía que apoyar a su madre para dar el sostenimiento a su familia.
Vive solo con su madre porque es él quien debe de estar pendiente de darle lo necesario y es por quien él trabaja todos los días.
Manuel se dedica a destazar cerdos y reses desde que era pequeño, pues su padre fue quien le enseño, trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo). Destaza dos veces a la semana y para llevar los cerdos tiene que salir a comprar a las comunidades aledañas, lo hace a pie porque no tiene transporte para acarrearlos hasta su casa donde tiene un corral.
También se dedica a la crianza de ganado en pequeña escala, actualmente tiene dos vacas y una novilla para producir leche y vender los derivados.
Manuel solicita un crédito en la institución para la compra de tres cerdos, ya tiene su clientela y un día antes del destazo sale por las tardes para anotar los encargos del producto y después solo pasar dejando el producto.
Con ello pretende obtener mayores ingresos económicos, para darle a su madre y a él mismo una mejor calidad de vida
Manuel sueña en comprar dos vacas más,  para aumentar su pequeño hato de ganado que posee, así en el futuro vender productos derivados de la leche, lo que le generaría mayores ingresos económicos para la familia. Lo lograra mediante las ganancias que obtiene del destazo y con sus ahorros comprara poco a poco sus vacas.
texts.en:
Manuel studied up to the second grade in his community. He is the oldest of six other brothers and he had to quit school because his father died; he was the one who had to help his mother provide for the family. Now his lives alone with his mother because he is the one who needs to be available to give her what she needs and she is the person ffor whom he works every day.

Manuel has worked butchering hogs and cattle since he was little; his father taught him the skill. He also works in agriculture (he sows corn, beans and millet.) He butchers two times a week and to obtain the pigs, he must go out to buy them in small villages and he does this on foot because he doesn´t have any means of transportation to take them to his house where he has a pen.

He also raises cattle on a small scale. At present he has two cows and a heifer to produce milk and sell milk products. 

Manual is asking for a loan from the institution to buy three pigs. He has a clientele and the day before slaughter, he goes around during the afternoon to jot down orders for products and then he delivers the product.  With his loan, he hopes to obtain a greater income, to give his mother and himself a better quality of life. Manuel also dreams of buying two additional cows to add to his small herd so that in the future he can sell milk products, which willl generate greater income for the family. He will achieve this through the profits he obtains from his butchering business and, with his savings, he will buy the cows little by little.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 66 años de edad, es padre de 7 hijos, de quienes tiene a cargo dos y un nieto, pues sus otros cinco hijos ya viven separados con sus propias familias en la misma comunidad donde reside actualmente. Es originario de un pueblo cercano de donde vive hoy en día, tuvo que emigrar debido a que le robaron todo en una ocasión y por eso decidió irse de donde está su familia. Su esposa trabaja en los quehaceres del hogar, y también le ayuda en los trabajos de la agricultura. 
Manuel solo estudio hasta el primer grado, tuvo que abandonar los estudios debido a que la zona de donde es originario en esa época era una zona de las más afectadas por la guerra civil que azoto en el país.
Manuel se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz,  frijoles y maicillo), rubro que le enseño su hermano mayor, pues son los cultivos que más se plantan en la zona oriental del país, aprendió desde los ocho años de edad cuando sus padres lo llevaban a los siembros, se decidió a la siembra de granos pues ayuda con ello para darle la alimentación a su familia, también trabaja cuidando por las tardes una casa de donde obtiene ingresos económicos para su familia. Además engorda cerdos y pollos para venderlos en la comunidad. Sus hijos siempre lo apoyan en los cuidos de los cultivos. Antes trabajo en la siembra de caña de azúcar y también trabajo en su juventud en el cultivo de henequén.
Manuel solicita un crédito en la institución para la compra de cuatro cerdos, harinilla, concentrado y otros productos para el mantenimiento de los cerdos , abono  y otros fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
Manuel sueña en comprar un terreno donde construir una mejor vivienda, ya que donde vive actualmente es muy pequeño y es de bahareque, así le permitiría tener una mejor condición de vida para el su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 66 years old. He is the father of 7 children and currently cares for two of them, plus one grandchild. His other five children live independently with their own families in the same community where he currently lives. He is originally from a village close to where he currently lives. He had to leave because he was once robbed of everything, and decided to move with his family. His wife is a homemaker and helps with agricultural work.

Manuel attended school until first grade and had to leave school because the area where he lived was one of the areas affected most by the civil war at that time.

Manuel makes a living by growing staple crops (corn, beans, and sorghum), which he learned from his older brother. These crops are the ones grown the most in the eastern part of the country. He learned to plant these crops when he was 8 years old when his parents began to take him to the fields. He decided to grow grains in order to provide food for his family. He also works in the afternoons as a caretaker at a home in order to earn additional income for his family. He also raises pigs and chickens to sell in the community. His children always help to care for the crops. Previously, he grew sugar cane and agave.

Manuel requests a loan from the institution to purchase four pigs, cornmeal, animal feed, other products to care for his pigs, manure, and fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

Manuel dreams of purchasing land to build a better home, since he currently lives in a very small bahareque home (wattle and daub home). This wayk, he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs, cornmeal, animal feed, other products for the pigs, manure, and other fertilizers to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, children’s clothes and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, fish and meat.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia is a 62-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small pancake business, selling to the people of her community and to the school children. She plans to use this loan to purchase two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, baking powder, two pots of cooking oil, a large frying pan, and a cooking stove for her business and to pay school fees for her children. Sesilia joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial assistance and has been able to provide for her family's everyday needs with the profits she is able to make from baking and selling her pancakes.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, a frying pan, and a cooking stove and to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a resident of Dipolog City and joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2014. She appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. 

Wilma works as a street sweeper as her source of income. Recently, she is asking a financial assistance of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase house materials intended for house renovation of their home. Through this, Wilma is very thankful with all her heart that she found assistance with her financial problems through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase house materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and an air conditioner and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is a 50-year-old mother of five children. She not only bakes, but she runs a small canteen where she sells to the schools and also members of her community. 

She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance so that she would be able to expand the variety of food she sells at her canteen. With the money she is applying for, Matauaina wishes to purchase boxes of sausages, milk, sugar, flour, cooking oil, tomato sauce, plastic bags, and a gas bottle. 

She hopes that she would be able to save most of the profits she would be making from her business so that she could provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of sausages, milk, sugar, flour, cooking oil, tomato sauce, plastic bags, and a gas bottle

loans.name: Nenna

texts.en:
Nenna is a 27-year-old married mother of three children. She runs a small bakery business and has joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. She sells her goodies to the school kids and members of her community. 

With this loan, Nenna is looking at purchasing sacks of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, and a cooking pot for her business. She hopes to make a lot of savings from the profits of her sales so that she would be able to provide a better living for her family without having to depend on others to take care of them.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, and a cooking pot

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en: Mataiumu is 46 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She grows and sells vegetables to people in her community and also to passers-by. She has been with the SPBD program for more than six years and is requesting this loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, rakes, shovels, fencing wire, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower to maintain and improve her vegetable garden. Mataiumu has managed to improve the living standards of her family with the profits she earns from her vegetable garden, and hopes to continue doing that.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, rakes, shovels, fencing wire, a wheel barrow, and a mist blower

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Hilary is a single lady of 21 years who is staying home to help out her family. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial assistance, especially some money to restock her shop.

With the money she is getting, she hopes to purchase sacks of sugar and flour, sacks of rice, boxes of tinned fish, and a freezer. 

Hilary hopes to have a variety of stocks sold in her shop with the profit she is able to make from her business, and also some savings to provide for her family's every essential  need.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and flour, sacks of rice, boxes of tinned fish, and a freezer

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es:
Jerobia es una pequeña comerciante de ropa nueva y usada. Vende ropa en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante cuando sus clientes lo requiere. A través de los años, ha solicitado crédito para poder mantener inventario de su negocio y aumentar la oferta hacia sus clientes. Con este crédito solicitado comprará paca de ropa usada y también ropa nueva. 

Jerobia está casada, su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos está a cargo de ella y se encuentran estudiando. Su meta siempre ha sido poder mantener los estudios de sus hijos, que ella piensa que es lo más valioso que le pueda dejar a sus hijos, y para eso se esfuerza diariamente, para poder generar ingresos para la manutención de su familia.
texts.en:
Jerobia has a small business selling new and used clothing from her home, though she also goes to her customers' homes upon request. Jerobia has applied for loans over the years in order to maintain her inventory and offer a greater variety of clothing to her customers. She will use the funds from this loan to purchase new and used clothing.  

Jerobia is married and the mother of four children. Her husband works outside the city and she cares for two of the children, who are in school. Jerobia has always strived to pay for her children's education, which she feels is the most crucial thing that she can give to her children. Her motivation for working hard each day is to earn income in order to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothing.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married with six children. She is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.                           

She is a farmer and grows corn and palay crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to to pay for chemicals and ten sacks of fertilizer.                                          

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more corn and rice crops.

loans.use: To pay for chemicals and ten sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 04 Quảng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lan has a retail business selling books, textbooks, and student supplies. She is applying for a loan to purchase more books, textbooks, and student supplies to resell.

Lan is 38 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group called the Nhóm 01 Thôn 04 Quảng Lộc solidarity group. Lan lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for one year  The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase books, textbooks and student supplies to resell

loans.name: 21 Đa Phạn, Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngâu works in agriculture raising poultry and pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in future.

Ngâu is 59 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 21 Đa Phạn, Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Ngâu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Ngâu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Ngâu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ngâu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and that she can build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Moserat

texts.en: Monserat is 58 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is married, the mother of five children, and has earned a living for the last five years by running a grocery store. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries and sacks of rice. Monserat has been a member of PMPC for three years, and her goal for the future is to expand her business into a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and five sacks of rice.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Natalina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as oils, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, body lotion, water, beer, eggs, Coca Cola, Sprite and Sagiko. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Natalina independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, body lotion, water, beer, eggs, and soft drinks

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Bendita to improve her business. She opened her second-hand clothing sales  in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy  trousers and shirts. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy trousers and shirts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as: cement, sand, cement blocks, 3/8” rebar, 1/4” rebar, rebare tie wire, and also labor.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramon trabaja como guarda se seguridad en una empresa privada, y es de esta manera como él lleva el sustento a su familia. Su compañera de vida es costurera y trabaja en su casa. Tiene 4 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad. Don Ramón está solicitando el crédito para construir el muro perimetral de su vivienda y también el porche. Comprará materiales de construcción como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena, piedrín y tablas. Sus planes después de este crédito será construir el muro trasero de su vivienda
texts.en: Ramon works as a private company as a security guard. He supports his family with this work. His life partner is a seamstress and works from home. They have four adult children. Ramon is requesting a loan to build a wall around his house and yard. He will buy construction materials such as cinderblocks, steel, cement, gravel, and wood. His plans with this loan are to build this wall in the back of his home.

loans.use: to construct a wall

loans.name: 12 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phong is 37 years old and married with two dependent children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Phong operates a food stall/restaurant selling nem chua (fermented/cured pork). She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Phong faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to make fermented/cured pork to sell.

Phong is the group leader of the 12 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2012, Phong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phong hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food to make fermented/cured pork to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toàn works in agriculture, raising poultry and farming rice. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Toàn faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in thefuture.

Toàn is 30 years old and married with one child. She is the leader of a six-member group, the Nhóm 05, Đồng Thọ, Vạn Hòa solidarity group. 

In 2010, Toàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Toàn hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 07 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt is 27 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 07 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

Nguyệt operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. This is Nguyệt’s first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: 52 Điện Biên Group

texts.en: Mrs. Năm earns a living by running a store where she sells soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks and sweets to resell to her customers. She is 52 years old, married, the mother of two children, and leads the 52 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Năm joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from the fund and has been in her current line of work for six years. Her main challenge is a lack of capital. With the profits made possible by this loan, Năm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and sweets to sell.

loans.name: 01.điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiên has a retail business selling electronic devices and paint. She is requesting a loan to purchase more electronic devices and paint to resell.

Hiên is 38 years old and she is married with two children. Hiên is the group leader of the 01.Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2011, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiên has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

The main hardship that Hiên faces in her business is the lack of capital. Hiên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic devices and paint to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a retail business selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Lan is 52 years old and she is married with three children. Lan is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for seven years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan operates a food stall selling soup and cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to make cake and soup to sell. Lan is 48 years old and she is married with two children. Lan is the group leader of the 04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. Lan lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food to make cake and soup to sell

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, en el distrito de Sallique, una zona rural con clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la carpintería, en el cual labora muebles, cómodas, camas, roperos entre otros, tiene clientela en la zona que requiere sus servicios, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales como metales y madera y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes diversas opciones de servicio.
texts.en:
Augusto is 54 years old and lives in his own home constructed of rustic material in the Sallique district, a rural area with a varied climate. Its population is engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. It's located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountains of northern Peru.
He earns his living in carpentry, manufacturing furniture, dressers, beds, wardrobes, and more. He has customers in the area that require his services. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles for the purchase of materials such as metals and wood to offer his customers different service options.

loans.use: to purchase metals and wood to offer variety to his clients

loans.name: 20 Đa Phạn, Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Phương is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 20 Đa Phạn, Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and that she can build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 07 Y Bích, Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lệ has a business selling salt. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to make salt to sell.
Lệ is 36 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 07 Y Bích, Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2014, Lệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lệ has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Lệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The most critical business difficulties that concern her are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Lệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to make salt to sell

loans.name: 130002.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a business selling bricks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to make bricks to sell. 

Hương is 34 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 130002.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2008, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make bricks to sell

loans.name: 36 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đông works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Đông is 49 years old and married with two children. Đông is the group leader of the 36 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Đông has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Đông faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Đông hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene un hijo dependiente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica al comercio de frutales, cultivos de arroz y café, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de arroz compra y venta, también compra la cascara de arroz y cafe a los agricultores de la zona para luego secarlo y pilarlo para luego a venderlos a las diferentes bodegas de la zona y caserios aledaños de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 600 nuevos soles para la compra de arroz en cascara, para posterirmente ofrecerlo a mayor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gabino is 52 years old. He is common-law married and has a dependent child living at home in the Pucara district, a community with a hot climate. Its population is engaged in the trade of fruit, rice, and coffee. It's located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the mountains of northern Peru.
He is a tradesman who buys and sells rice. He also buys the unhusked rice and coffee from growers in the region. He dries and processes them before selling them to different stores and nearby farms in his district. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 2,600 Peruvian nuevos soles for the purchase of unhusked rice to sell at a higher price and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase unhusked rice to process and sell at higher prices

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines  and vitamins for her pigs.

Annie has been in this business for five years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Annie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines  and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Karla Lissette

texts.es:
Karla de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado, ya no pudo estudiar porque todo el tiempo se ha dedicado al comercio vive con su madre, juntas sostienen el negocio.
Karla desde hace años se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas y verduras en la terminal de buses, además vende bebidas  como; gatorade, frescos, agua y gaseosas el horario de su negocio es de 5:AM a 5.PM.
Karla utilizara el préstamo para comprar más gatorade, frescos, agua y gaseosas, ya que teniendo más inventario obtendrá mejores ingresos y más clientes. Karla sueña con tener un puesto más grande y mantener su clientela, además poco a poco ir ahorrando para comprar su casa y vivir cómodamente con su madre,  así evitara andar alquilando, las ganancias las utilizara para cancelar las cuota en la institución.
texts.en:
Karla is 37 years old. She studied until 2nd grade. She could not study because she devoted all her time to her business. She lives with her mother. Together, they support the business. 

For many years, Karla has made a living selling fruits and vegetables in the bus terminal. In addition, she sells beverages such as Gatorade, soft drinks, water, and sodas. Her business hours are 5 AM to 5 PM.

Karla will use the loan to buy more Gatorade, soft drinks, water, and sodas, since with more inventory she will earn a higher income and more customers. Karla dreams of having a larger stall and maintaining her customer base. She will also start saving little by little to buy a house and live comfortably with her mother. That way she will avoid renting. She will use her earnings to pay off her debt to the institution.

loans.use: to buy more Gatorade, soft drinks, water, and sodas, since with more inventory she will earn a higher income and more customers.

loans.name: Alexy Carolina

texts.es:
Alexy es una persona de 32  años de edad,  es una madre de 3 hijos  de los  cuales son dos varones  y una niña todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, la señora posee un negocio propio que se trata de una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, que está ubicada en el centro de su comunidad  ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que cuenta con valores y principios morales y espirituales es muy reconocida por las personas de su comunidad por su actividad productiva, por su forma de vivir con los vecinos, ella se dedicó a trabajar en una tienda cuando era joven y fue allí donde comenzó y adquirió experiencia para poner en practica esta actividad, luego adquirió un crédito para poner su propia tienda y así comenzó con su negocio y hasta el día de hoy se mantiene trabajando y con ayuda de su esposo, dan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos fundamentales a sus hijos e hija. 


La señora tiene una experiencia de 16 años en trabajar con tienda experiencia que adquirió cuando se desempeñó trabajando en una tienda y fue allí donde adquirió conocimiento para realizar esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas las que al cumplir su proceso de crecimiento son puestas a la venta. 

El dinero será invertido, para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, bebidas, golosinas, galletas, detergentes, para la tienda  y gallinas ponedoras para la  crianza y posteriormente vender huevos y carne de gallina ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá una evidente mejora en las ganancias económicas en su tienda y mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Los sueños de la señora Alexy son los de ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad, que sean unos profesionales de excito personas de bien, que le sirvan a su familia y a su comunidad, también quiere ampliar su negocio y montar una crianza de cerdos y esto lo va lograr con ayuda de otro financiamiento según expreso y también se proyecta a comprar un vehículo el cual le facilitara el traslado de mercadería.
texts.en:
Alexy is 32 and the mother of three children, two boys and a girl. All of her children are getting their basic education in a community school.  Alexy owns her own business, a store located in the center of her community where she sells basic necessities.  She is very hard-working and responsible, with moral and spiritual values and principles.  She is very well-known by the people in her community for her active productivity, and for how she gets along with her neighbors.  Alexy went to work in a shop when she was young, and it was there that she began and acquired the experience to carry out her current work; then she got a loan to establish her own store and thus began her business. And even today, she continues working, and with the help of her husband, has been providing for the daily needs of her family and guaranteeing fundamental rights to their sons and daughter.

She has 16 years of experience working as a shopkeeper, experience which she acquired while working in a store.  Alexy is also engaged in raising chickens which are offered for sale after they grow to market size. 

With this loan, Alexy will invest in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, salt, beverages, candy, cookies, and detergent for her store; as well as laying hens for breeding and then selling the eggs and chicken meat as this has become her primary source of income.  By doing this, she will be able to provide a better level of service to her customers and have an obvious improvement in the economic profits for her store.  Also, she will improve the quality of life for her family.  

Alexy's dreams are to see her children graduate from university, become professionals and successful, and be good people who serve their families and the community.  She also wants to expand her business and set up a pig-raising business which she going to achieve using other funding, and also possibly purchase a vehicle that will help in transporting goods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, beverages, candy, cookies, and detergent for her store; as well as laying hens for breeding and then selling the eggs and chicken meat as this has become her primary source of income.

loans.name: Fuatino Josephine

texts.en: Fuatino is a 22-year-old woman with one child. She has a vegetable garden business that she started six months ago. She has just joined SPBD seeking financial assistance to further improve and enhance her vegetable garden to make a decent profit to take care of her family. She plans to use this loan to purchase vegetable seeds, a mist blower, chemicals, rakes, fertilizers, bush knives, rolls of fencing wire, spades, and shovels to further expand her garden. Fuatino hopes to improve her family's livelihood with the profit she makes from her business and not have to depend on family overseas for money.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, a mist blower, chemicals, rakes, fertilizers, bush knives, wire, spades, and shovels

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 47 years old, lives with her two children and father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an inspector at the tax authority since 2002. Her two children go to school. Her father has retired from work and receives a state pension. Her husband passed away long ago. She is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to pay her son's tuition fee. Her son studies at Russian Mongolian Joint High School, and she thinks a good education can open many opportunities for her son.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd, 48, lives with her two children in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's toys during celebrations and events for children since 2010. Before toy sales, she worked at a boots factory. 

Altansuvd's husband has passed away, and she alone carries the whole burden of raising her children. Her elder child, a son, studies at university, and her daughter goes to high school. In just one year, her son will graduate from university and will be able to find a secure job and contribute to the family. 

Before then, Altansuvd wants to improve her family's living conditions through her business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy children's toys in large amounts at wholesale prices. With this loan, she can continue to run her business without worrying about a shortage of inventory.

loans.use: to buy children's toys in large amounts

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH représente le groupe SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 03 ans. Il va à l’école (maternelle).
Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 rangée de bois.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour son enfant. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et scolariser son enfant dans une école privée.
texts.en:
Mme Azila Judith represents the group called Sababougnouma. She is in good health. Married, she is a mother of one child aged three. He goes to nursery school. 

 She has been selling firewood for 10 years. She replenishes her stock by having wood delivered at her home. She wants to buy one row of firewood. 

She wants to save her profit for her child. Her ambition is to grow her business and put her child into private school.

loans.use: to buy one row of firewood

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, tiene dos hijos bajo su poder, posee un hogar estable, en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya ordeñando el ganado lechero que posteriormente ofrece a la venta leche fresca y quesos que ella misma prepara.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno para cría y de esta manera vender el ganado a un mayor precio en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo is 27, lives with his spouse, and has two children.  He had a stable home in the district of Colasay, a community strong in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock, located in the Province of Jaén in the  Region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Victor Hugo is engaged in raising and selling cattle.  His wife helps him by milking dairy cattle and subsequently offering fresh milk and cheese that she herself prepares for sale. 

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy cattle for breeding and thus to sell cattle at a better price in the coming months.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding and thus sell cattle for a better price

loans.name: Almagro

texts.es:
Almagro tiene 31 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge tiene dos hijos en su poder de 6 y 4 años de edad, los cuales estudian en la escuela del Caserío de Viza, una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomás, tiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la agricultura, cultiva una ha de cafeto de variedad catimor desde hace tres años, también se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, los que vende en el mercado de su Distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago a jornaleros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Almagro is 31 years old and has a stable household in Caserío de Viza, a rural area in Santo Tomás District, in Cutervo Province in the Cajamarca Region in the northern sierra of Peru. Many people in this area work in farming or ranching or run shops. Almagro lives with his wife and two children, who are four and six and study in the local primary school. The family lives in their own home made of recycled building materials. 

Almagro is a farmer and grows the Catimor variety of coffee on a one-hectare plot. He also raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, and hogs, which he sells at the San Tomás District market.  

Almagro has applied for a loan of 500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of manure and to pay laborers so that he can maintain his coffee crop. A successful crop will generate higher income for Almagro and his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pay laborers in order to maintain his coffee crop

loans.name: 10 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Thắm, 34, is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. 

Thắm has a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for  five years. The main harship she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the group leader of the 10 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. 

In 2013, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mery Raquel

texts.es:
Mery de 43 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios y valores, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  además los fines de semana se dedica a vender tamales en la plaza del pueblo y a diario se dedica a la venta de tortillas.

 Mery se  creció junto a sus padres quienes eran personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que también se dedicaban a la venta de tortillas y pan, su familia se dedicaba todos los días a realizar este tipo de negocios ya que fue lo que les brindó la oportunidad de salir adelante y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, siendo ella la mayor de todos sus hermanos a quien le correspondía ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y en las ventas del negocio de su familia; por esa razón se le hizo difícil completar sus estudios de educación básica alcanzando únicamente hasta el tercer grado, trascurrió el tiempo y con una edad adecuada conoció al que ahora es su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, y son padres de 2 hijos y 1 hija, de los que dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela nacional y el tercero aun no cumple con la edad adecuada para asistir a la escuela.


La señora se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, con una experiencia de 31 años,  actividad que aprendió de sus padres y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pan y los demás días de semana se dedica a la venta de tortillas realizando estas actividades lleva más de 10 años y continuara haciéndolo, ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos de donde les proporciona ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, a esta actividad se suma su hija la mayor y lo hace por las tardes ya que las mañanas las dedica a estudiar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar  una refrigeradora y un mostrador de comida, ya que los electrodomésticos que tiene han cumplido con su vida útil, y para agilizar y mejorar su negocio necesita contar con estos equipos ya que ha comenzado a vender comida y pretende mejorar su negocio de esta forma dará un mejor servicio y mejoraran sus ganancias económicas. 

Las sueños y metas que la señora Mery tiene para un futuro son las de haber terminado de pagar el préstamo y hacer una nueva solicitud para extender su negocio de comida que funciona de lunes a viernes, en cuento a sus hijos, apoyarlos hasta que finalicen sus estudios universitarios,  ya que manifiesta que están empeñados en estudiar y ser agrónomos  y su hija quiere ser enfermera y todo esto lo va lograr con ayuda del préstamo y la inversión de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mery is a 43-year-old businesswoman and mother guided by strong principles and values. She manages her family's household, but also sells tortillas and on weekends goes to the town plaza to sell tamales. 

Mery was raised by hardworking and humble parents, who had a business selling tortillas and bread. Mery's family worked at this business every day, which allowed them to meet their basic needs and achieve some success. Mery was the oldest child, so she was responsible for the various household tasks and also for sales for the family business. It was therefore difficult for her to finish elementary school, and she only attended through the third grade. When Mery grew up, she married a farmer, and the couple has two sons and a daughter. Two of the children attend the national school, but the youngest is not yet old enough to start school. 

Mery has been responsible for managing a household, her parents' or her own, for 31 years. She has sold tortillas on weekdays and  bread on weekends for the past ten years, and plans to keep doing so. Bread and tortilla sales have become her main source of income and her means of meeting her children's basic needs. Mery's daughter helps her in the afternoons after she leaves her morning school session.  

Mery will use the funds from this loan to purchase a refrigerator and a food display case, which will replace old appliances that are reaching the end of their service lives. Mery has also begun selling other foods and is trying to improve her business, offer better service to her customers, and boost her income.
