Mery's dreams and aspirations for the future are to pay off this loan, apply for another one in order to expand her food business, and support her children through their university studies. Her sons are studying to become agronomists and her daughter wants to become a nurse. Mery and her children will be able to fulfill their aspirations with his loan and the investment of her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and food display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent land to obtain soil to make bricks

loans.name: Pito

texts.en: Pito is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small sewing business, sewing dresses and shirts for people around her village. She also bakes pancakes to sell, as another means of earning money. She requires financial assistance, and that is why she has just joined SPBD. With the money she is requesting, Pito will purchase a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and fabric materials for her sewing business. She hopes that she will be able to save some money from the profit she will be earning in order to provide a decent living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and fabric materials.

loans.name: Delfer

texts.es:
Delfer tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto con su conyugue y su hijo de 8 años de edad el cual cursa primaria en colegio nacional del Caserío de Mangaypa, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor cocinando los alimentos para asistir a los jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos fitosanitarios y fertilizantes que le permitirán un mantenimiento a sus cultivos y por ende una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Delfer, 30 lives in his own home, which is made of rudimentary materials.  He lives with his wife and his 8 year-old son, who attends  the local public elementary school in the Mangaypa settlement in a rural area of the Pomahuaca district.  In this community the residents work in farming, commerce, and animal husbandry.  It is located in Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Delfer is a farmer who cultivates coffee.  His wife helps him with this work by cooking food for the farmworkers who maintain the coffee crops.  He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy pesticides and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crops so that he can increase his production.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Jaqueline Noely

texts.es:
Jaqueline Noely tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, reside en caserío El Chorro, una zona rural del Distrito de Morropon, hace más de 20 años junto a sus hijos, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de soya cocinada en los caseríos aledaños de su distrito desde hace dos años, también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores como aves de corral para engordar y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jaqueline Noely is 25 years old and is single. She has been living in the small town of El Chorro, in a rural area in the district of Morropon, for more than 20 years. She lives there with her children. Life in the community is tranquil because people work in commerce and raising small animals. The community is located in the province of ths same name, which belongs to the region of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

She has been making and selling cooked soy in the small towns of her district for the past two years. She also raises domestic fowl.

She has requested a loan of 1,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy small animals, such as domestic fowl, to fatten them up and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as domestic fowl, to fatten them up and sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASSEKDE représente le groupe TONGNOOMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 01enfant. Il est âgé de 04ans. Il ne va à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes, des habits prêt à porter  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 1/2 balle de pagnes.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son secteur d’activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. SOMPASSEKDE represents the group TONGNOOMA. She is doing well. She is married with one child, age 4, who does not go to school. She supports three people. 

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and ready-to-wear clothing for five years. She buys her stock at the local market. 

She wants to purchase half a bale of pagnes. She plans to reinvest her profits in order to expand her field of activity. Her goals are to open a store to sell her pagnes, and to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 1/2 bale of pagnes.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de edades 6 y 3 años de edad de los cuales el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional del Caserío de Mangaypa, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una zona de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, tiene sembrado en su parcela cercana a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Anibal is a 27-year-old coffee farmer from Caserío de Mangaypa, a rural area in Pomahuaca District in Jaén Province in the Cajamarca Region of the northern Peruvian sierra. This area has a variable climate, and many people there are farmers, ranchers, or shopkeepers. Anibal lives with his wife and two children, ages three and six, in the family's own home made of recycled building materials. The children attend the primary school in Caserío de Mangaypa. 

Anibal grows coffee on a plot near his home. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase manure that he'll use in the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.use: to purchase manure for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana de 43 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, la situación económica no le permitió seguir estudiando, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo tres viven con ella, nos comento que con su primera pareja procrearon 4 hijos, pero el murió, y después de unos cuantos años se volvió a acompañar pero luego la abandono su pareja.


Ana se dedica al comercio de frutas, ropa, lociones y mas, desde hace 20 años trabajo que aprendió por la misma necesidad, para sacar adelante a su familia. Ana compra ropa en la capital y la vende en los caseríos aledaños donde vive. Con su pareja aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura, el cual le ha sido de mucho provecho. Su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 12:00 del mediodia, luego se dedica a la venta de lociones y ropa por la tarde.



El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono y veneno para preparar la tierra donde va a realizar la siembra de maíz.


El sueño de Ana es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen, comprar un terrenito para construir una vivienda y mejorar su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old. She studied through 6th grade, but her economic situation didn't allow her to continue studying. She is a single mother and has 6 children, of whom three live with her. She explains that she had 4 children with her first partner, but he died. A few years later she was in another relationship, but her partner left her.

Ana has been selling fruits, clothing, perfumes, and other things for more than 20 years. She learned how to do this work out of the necessity of supporting her family. Ana buys clothing in the capital and sells it in the small villages where she lives. With her partner, she learned agricultural work, which has been very useful to her. Her work schedule is from 5:00am to 12:00pm, and after that she sells perfumes and clothing in the afternoon.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land where she will plant corn.

Ana's dreams are for her children to study and prepare themselves for a career, to buy a little piece of land so she can build a house, and to improve her business so she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land where she will plant corn.

loans.name: Leuta

texts.en: Leuta is a 62-year-old married mother of eight children. She runs a small plantation business and is assisted by her husband and children. She sells her produce to the people around her community and to the public. She plans to use this money to purchase a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and fertilizers for the improvement of her plantation business, and nails and iron roofing for her home renovation. Leuta joined the SPBD program in 2011 and has managed to improve their family's standard of living with the profits she has earned from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizers, nails and iron roofing

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She wants to start a meat bun and an ice block business selling to the people around her village and to schoolchildren. She knows how to make these things and has decided to use the business as a way to make money. This is the reason she just joined the SPBD program. With this money, she plans to purchase a sack of flour, vanilla, cooking oil, chicken leg quarters, baking powder, a wok, a large pot, and large spoons for her meat bun business, plastic cups, cordial, and sugar for her ice block business. She hopes to save a lot of the profit she is able to earn to make some improvements on her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, vanilla, cooking oil, chicken, baking powder, a wok, a pot, spoons, plastic cups, and cordials

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Enkhsaikhan is 40 years old and a resident of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. He is a taxi driver and has been running his business for eight years around the districts of Ulaanbaatar. Currently, his business is the main source of income for the family. Enkhsaikhan is a hardworking man and works 12-15 hours a day. 

He completed the foundation of the house, and now he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy materials to build a new house for his family.
If he builds his house, his family will live in comfortable conditions. And in winter, they will use less coal, which pollutes the air in their country.

loans.use: to buy materials for his new house.

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayartsetseg, 48 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a laboratory technician at a power plant for more than twenty years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their children both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to build a garage in order to preserve her car safely. Leaving her car outside harms its efficiency such as emitting harmful pollutants and wasting more fuel. With a high quality garage, she can use her car without any worry.

loans.use: to build a garage.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is 40 years old and has worked as a hairdresser for over twenty years. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with her husband and daughter. Otgontsetseg had two daughters but one died untimely. Her daughter Narangerel gave birth a child and stays at home. 

Otgontsetseg adopted two boy orphans from her relatives. Now the boys have become adults and live apart in a house which she and her husband built for them. She is requesting loan of 2.000.000 MNT to buy a car from the taxi service company for her adopted son and he will run a taxi service, so he can earn for himself and his brother.

loans.use: to buy a car for her adopted son

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 21-year-old married woman from Tubas, a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother of one small son. Her husband is a worker in the municipality where he gets a low income. 

She owns and works in a store for selling frozen vegetables. It is a good business and she can help her family in part of their expenses. Hala appears in the photo in her store.

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new refrigerator for her frozen food store. By taking this loan, Hala will be able to increase the inventory size and also her income.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for her frozen food store.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 44 años de edad, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta cuarto grado por la escases del dinero y la falta de profesores que impartieran clases en esa época se obligó a no continuar estudiando por esta razones prefirió cultivar la tierra junto a su madre y sus demás hermanos que enfrentaban la misma situación que él.  Él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, ellos procrearon 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, su esposa y él solo vive junto a sus 2 hijos, comenta que siempre recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa  en las actividades que realiza en los cultivos y son únicas personas que dependen de él.  


Alejandro se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol) desde que él estaba pequeño sus padres le inculcaron a aprender este trabajo como era la única alternativa de trabajo y de ingresos en aquellos  tiempos, por eso se dedicaba a la agricultura. Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura también se dedica a la ganadería en la compra y venta de  ganado que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos para su familia, él para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que caminar 1 hora a pie y que también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposa para realizar los trabajos agrícolas
 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz y frijol.  El préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer una necesidad de sembrar sus cultivos y hacerlos más adecuadamente y eficientemente en el tiempo específico sin mayores complicaciones de perdida


Alejandro desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia, y obtener  mayor  producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean  personas profesionales y logren terminar su estudios y sacar  una carrera universitaria todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposa y mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 44 years old and only had the opportunity to study up to Grade 4 for lack of money and a lack of teachers at the time. He was forced to discontinue his schooling and he preferred to work the land along with his mother and his siblings who faced the same situation. He is married and his wife takes care of the house. They have two children who are in school and they are the only people dependent on him. He and his wife and children live together with no one else.

Alejandro grows basic grains (corn and beans). He comments that he get help from his wife and his children to carry out the activities with the crops. His parents taught him how to do this when he was quite young as it was the only form of work and source of income at that time. So he farms. Besides his crops he also buys and sells cattle as another activity to generate funds for the family. It takes him one hour to walk to the land he works. His wife and children help him with his work.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay for labor to grow corn and beans. The loan will help him to satisfy the need to grow his crops in an efficient, adequate and timely manner without the complication of crop loss. Alejandro wants a better quality of living for his family and himself in the future. He would also like to obtain higher production with his basic grains and live comfortably in a dignified place with his children. He wants his children to continue to study so that in the future they become professionals, studying at university. He can achieve all this with a lot of effort and dedication alongside his wife and with a lot of work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and pay for labor to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Eddy Cleofe

texts.es:
Eddy Cleofe tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres en una casa de material rústico en el Caserío Pueblo Nuevo, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, contando con los servicios de agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Eddy es la venta de plátanos, en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo del mismo que le permitirá tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eddy Cleofe is 50 years old and is single. He lives in his parent's house. The house is built of rustic materials in the small town of Pueblo Nuevo, in a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires. It has water and electricity. The people of the town work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle. The town is located in the the province of Morropon, which belongs to the region of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

Eddy's business os selling plantains in the district market. He has requested a loan of 4,000.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy fertilizers for maintaining his crop. This will allow him to have improved production to offter to his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining his crop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 60 years old and married with 4 children of adult age. She is a businesswoman and uses her business as one of their sources of income. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 4 years. She borrowed money in the amount of Php. 35,000 for the purpose of buying more fruits, such as bananas, etc. for her buy and sell business. She is hoping for the improvement of the business as well as an upscale livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, such as bananas, etc. for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro is 60 years old, married and had five children. He is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. In his previous harvest, he only gained a minimal income due to drought. His income was used to cover their bills at home and other expenses in farming. 

He is in need of additional capital of PHP 40,000 to be used in his farming business this planting season. He will buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides and pay the labor costs of farming. 

Someday, Casimiro hopes to achieve better crop production to result in economic stability for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides and pay labor costs of farming.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children. She runs a small flea market business where she sells her produce from her plantation, and also runs a bingo game as another means of earning money. She has been doing this for 2 years now and she finds that she is actually making good money out of it. With this money, she plans to purchase fertilizers, bush knives, a mist blower, chemicals for her plantation, a bingo machine, bingo packets, laundry soaps, laundry detergents and rice for her bingo business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, bush knives, a mist blower, chemicals, a bingo machine, bingo packets, laundry soaps, laundry detergents and rice.

loans.name: Uimailuma

texts.en:
Uimailuma is a 39-year-old mother of one child. She does her sewing from home and people of her community and other neighboring villages come to her to have their dresses or shirts made. She has been doing this for more than two years now. 

With this money she is reapplying for, she hopes to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing table, sewing chair, and fabric materials for her business. Uimailuma has managed to make some improvements in her family's living standards with the profits she has made from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, sewing table, sewing chair, and fabric materials

loans.name: Samantha

texts.en:
Samantha is a 19-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a small Elei fabric-printing business. She wants to help out financially to support her family; this is the reason why she has just joined the SPBD program this year in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

With the money she is applying for, Samantha wants to buy fabric paints, sponges and brushes, designed board, and fabric materials to further improve her Elei printing business. She hopes to save some of the profits she will be getting so that she would be able to cater to her familly's essential needs, and reinvest the other money back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric paints, sponges and brushes, designed board, and fabric materials

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 27-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband does the fishing work, and she helps out with selling the catch. They sell to the people around their community and to the general public. Epifania has been doing this for more than three years. 

With this loan, she will purchase a canoe, goggles, fishing gear (body suit and fishing boots), spear, torch, cooler, snorkel to further enhance her fishing business. 

Epifania has been able to improve her family's living standards from the profits they were able to save from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a canoe, goggles, fishing gear (body suit and fishing boots), spear, torch, cooler and snorkel

loans.name: Altantulga

texts.en: Mr. Altantulga, 38 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a car driver at a steel factory since 2011. His wife sells clothes at a trade center. Their children go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to dig a well on his land. As a result, he can grow vegetables such as potatoes, cabbages and carrots for domestic use. Also, he will save time and money by getting water from his land.

loans.use: to dig a well on his land.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is 38 years old, married, and has two sons. Eldaniz is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and sons in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Eldaniz has bred cattle for the last five years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Eldaniz usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profit price at the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN, and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

This is his first loan from Aqroinvest. Eldaniz needs 1,200 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milk cow. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Abdeljabbar

texts.en:
Abdel Jaber is a 28-years-old single young man from Jenin. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His brothers are construction workers who get low and unstable incomes. 

Abdel Jaber has a small mobile phone repair workshop. He has good experience in this field and the demand is high

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his mobile workshop. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to repair the mobiles and reprogram them. This will help him to improve his business and also his income. 

Abdel appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his mobile workshop

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg, 47 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a restaurant since 2011. Her husband supplies meat to a sausage factory. Their two children both have the profession of electrical engineers and work at power plants. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan has succeeded in maintaining his pig business. With a 24-month loan cycle, he can sell pigs many times and earn a satisfactory profit. With the full support of his wife, he was able to pay off all the loan before the due date. His entire family feels the benefit. Now they can fulfill their daily needs and make savings. I Wayan spoke of his gratitude to Lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Now he has a new plan. Besides still managing the pigs, I Wayan wants to improve his garden. With a new loan he will purchase soybean seed, fertilizer and insecticide. He will plant the soybeans in his garden. I Wayan hopes for the best results. With a new plan, he expects a better income and a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase soybean seed, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material like cement, re-bar, sand and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and purchase educational equipment for her daughter

loans.name: 020003.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en: Mrs. Xuân earns a living by raising poultry, and is requesting this loan to buy young poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 36 years old, married, the mother of two children and also leads the 020003.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which has four members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2007, Xuân joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one prior loan from the fund, and has been involved in her current line of work for more than 10 years. One of her main challenges is a shortage of capital. With the profits she earns from this loan, Xuân hopes for her children to do well in school, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is a 46-year-old woman. She is living in Rizal village with her lovely family - her husband and their four children.  Marivic has been in the poultry business for many years. She raises chickens and sells their eggs and meat. Today, to expand her poultry farm and buy more chickens, she needs a loan in the amount of Php 15,000. She is very grateful to the Kiva organization and to the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to expand her poultry farm and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 34 years old and lives in the town of Rizal. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Sheryl has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells broilers, eggs, and layers. 

To help expand her business, Sheryl has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy poultry feeds, drinkers, and food and will help Sheryl to generate greater profits and expand her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big farm.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds, drinkers and food and will help Sheryl to generate greater profits and expand her business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to buy products to sell to her customers and educate her children. Her income from the loan helped her meet everyday expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise to sell, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and on hand, the higher her profits and the more able she is to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nida's goals for the future are to expand her business and have a happy and contented family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells utensils and other household goods. 

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be operating the business in a temporary structure. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better business man. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and repay the loan.

loans.use: buy more stock of utensils and other items

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida requested a PHP 1,500 loan through PMPC to buy agri-fertilizer for her rice land. She has been in this business for 11 years now. Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase agri-fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for 14 years and she earns well from this activity. The couple has had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income to provide their children with a better education, which they don't currently have. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. 

To improve sales, Mercedita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 30,000 Philippine pesos, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mercedita dreams that she could also handle purchases for wholesalers. She also hopes her family will always be in good hands.

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura Soza: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 40 años de edad, casada con  5 hijos: Dos mayores de edad y tres menores de edad.  Desde hace 3 años se trasladaron al municipio de Puerto Cabezas, por motivos laborales de su esposo que trabaja de manera formal, en el juzgado. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció su negocio de venta de verduras y una pequeña pulpería: Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Sopas instantáneas, granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Maura Soza is from Waspam. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 chilren, two of whom are of age and three of whom are still minors. Three years ago they moved to the city of Puerto Cabezas for her husband's work, since he has a formal job in the municipal judge's office. Two years ago, with the goal of having her own source of income, she started her own business selling vegetables and a small grocery store. She is requesting a second loan in order to buy merchandise: instant soups, basic grains, and root vegetables, among other products. Her dream is to have to a prosperous business and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy instant soups, basic grains, and root vegetables, among other products.

loans.name: Digna Floridalva

texts.es:
Digna de 29 años de edad, estudio bachillerato comercial opción secretariado, con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar bachillerato, pero debido a que tenía que trabajar no continuo con sus estudios universitarios, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y dos hermanos más en su casa habitan 6 personas sus padres, sus dos hermanos, su hija y ella.


Digna es empleada en un supermercado, su cargo es  de cajera tiene dos años de trabajar, comenta que obtuvo este trabajo gracias a una amiga que la recomendó para trabajar, ella vive en  la ciudad donde trabaja para trasladarse a su lugar de  trabajo se tarda 2 horas en el bus,  por la distancia se tiene que quedar en la ciudad, el horario de trabajo es indefinido debido a que es rotativo en diversos turnos del día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para colocar dos puertas y dos ventanas de madera, y poder ampliarla más su casa, hacerle una habitación para tener más espacio y poder vivir más cómodamente con su familia.

Para el futuro desea terminar su casa tenerla más amplia y poner su  negocio para así tener más ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida, también comenta que desea seguir estudiando y poder tener una carrera universitaria y también desea  ayudarle económicamente a su hija para que en un futuro pueda estudiar y tener una carrera universitaria y poder valerse por sí sola.
texts.en:
Digna is 29 years old. She earned a secondary school business diploma with the secretarial studies option. She put great effort into earning her diploma, but because she had to work, she did not continue with her university education. She is a single mother with one two-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents and two other siblings. In their house live six people: her parents, her two siblings, her daughter, and herself. 

Digna is employed in a supermarket; she holds a position as a cashier and she has worked there for two years. She says that she obtained this work thanks to a friend who recommended her for the job. She lives in the city where she works. To get to her workplace takes two hours by bus; because of the distance, she has to stay in the city. Her work schedule is varied because they rotate through different shifts each day. 

The loan that she is requesting is to install two wooden doors and two wooden windows, and to expand her house more by creating a bedroom to have more space in order to live more comfortably with her family. In the future, she would like to finish her house to make it more spacious and set up a shop in order to have more economic income to improve her quality of life. 

Digna also mentions that she would like to continue her education and to be able to have a university degree. She also would like to help her daughter economically so that in the future she can study and earn a university degree and be able to support herself.

loans.use: to install two wooden doors and two wooden windows, and to add a bedroom to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Pakuza

texts.en:
Pakuza is a 48-year-old woman with three children.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and sons in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than ten years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family.

Her income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future her sons will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

Pakuza needs a 1500 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her fifth  loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and fruit trees.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a 48-years-old IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and children. He is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 15 years. During this time, Nabi has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables daily and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table and are also used to make fresh punch. 

Nabi  usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 80 AZN. As his products are in high demand, he wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. He has therefore applied for a loan of 600 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers. Nabi has a good client history and this will be his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Erdenebayar, 29, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been working as environmental protector in special zones for six years. His wife is an inspector at a hospital. Their son goes to kindergarten. Erdenebayar is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and planks to expand his house. After putting an extension on his house, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. His current house is very small and there is no space for his growing child to play.

loans.use: to add an extension to his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cement blocks, purlins (c-beams), sand, cement, and also to pay for labor.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a carpentry business where he makes cupboards and other furniture. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to own a big carpentry shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.use: buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel, 48 years of age, is married to a nurse and they were blessed with 1 child. He owns and has operated a welding shop in their village for almost twenty years, earning a net income of around PHP 500 daily. His income is usually spent on their daily expenditures. That's why he's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase welding equipment for his welding shop, so that he can improve his business. He's hoping that his welding shop will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment for his welding shop.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married and lives in the Rizal of Isabela. She is running a poultry business, selling broiler chickens to help feed her community. She is very proud of the progress she has made so far in her business and would like to see it grow. When she is not busy with her chickens, she is volunteering cleaning in the community. 

She enjoys operating her poultry business and needs a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks as well as the chemicals and feed in bulk to increase her profit margin. Eliza’s profits will help to raise the quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks as well as the chemicals and feed in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy educational materials for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing and home decor

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for almost three years and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by trading frozen foods and engaging herself in a direct selling business.

Jennie would like to take a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for additional stock. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman and to become a more efficient mother to her children.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina has been operating her own fruits and vegetable stand for many years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income to provide their children with better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Eufrocina would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. At an amount of PHP 10,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of fruits, veggies and other items needed to expand her inventory. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Eufrocina hopes to grow her business so she could give her children a good and quality education and likewise to enable her to help others in need.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables needed for her business.

loans.name: Kibeedi Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan married man, aged 35, living with two children aged 10 and 2 years, only one of whom is attending school. 

He lives in Kagadi where he sells produce from farming and sells milk to improve household income. He hopes to grow his business and educate his children. 

Robert is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize for selling. He is a member of Kibeedi Tukurakurane where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
The group paid off its previous loan on time, and sold the pigs at a good price. Now the price for pork is about 28,000 IDR per kilogram. Ni Kadek, the head of the group, maintained four superior pigs and all sold. She gained a profit of 2,000,000 IDR for all. She’s really grateful for that. She has a plan to use the profits to renovate her kitchen and to save money. During the last loan period, she did not have any problems. All the pigs grew well. She thanks the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. 

Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah group received a new loan, with 15 members and a total loan amount of 22,500,000 IDR. Having been successful with pig fattening, Ni Kadek will use this loan to purchase four local pigs and will be maintaining them for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to repair a cage for the preparation of a new birth from the sow that Ni Kadek already owns. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about the business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home and also save for the future of her family.

The group also expects a regular visit from a veterinarian, to make getting medicines and consultation easier.

loans.use: to purchase four local pigs and to repair a cage.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa is 25 years old and not married. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than three years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make a profit in order to support her family.  Zarifa’s income from her business is 100 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. Zarifa needs a 600 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to get married and have a child. This is her first loan and she hopes that Kiva will help her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees

loans.name: Ruline Vem

texts.en:
Ruline Vem is married with one child.  She is 38 years old and lives in P-3 Clarin,Philippines.

She sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Ruline Vem has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hope to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 52 years old, married and has a child that she is sending to high school. She and her spouse plant and harvest corn to sell to traders. Wilma is also a government employee at Alcala. She is now asking for additional capital of 30,000 PHP to sustain her crops. She will buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. These farm supplies will help maintain good crop production. Wilma and her spouse hope to achieve better crop production for the next harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Muslima, who is in her late 40's, is married with two children; one of them is still at school and the other one is grown up.  She has been running two business, selling cosmetics and vending food, since 2007.  She works from 8 AM to 4 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Muslima's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food stock whenever she got a new loan and started selling cosmetics.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy rice, flours, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking and cosmetics to resell.  She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Muslima will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, flours, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura de 48 años de edad, solo estudio hasta primer grado debido a que cuando ella estudiaba las escuelas quedaban lejos y por la distancia no podía desplazarse a la escuela, entonces sus padres optaron por no ponerla a estudiar, es soltera tiene 2 hijos uno de 19 años y otro de 24 años el menor estudio hasta bachillerato y el mayor solamente estudio noveno grado, ambos trabajan, en su casa viven 3 personas sus dos hijos y ella.

Rosaura se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también por ser una mujer soltera tiene que dedicarse a la agricultura, siembro de granos básicos como son el maíz y frijol, comenta que cuando era pequeña su padre la llevaba a trabajar y fue así como ella aprendió este trabajo y cuando tuvo sus hijos para mantenerlos tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura, comenta que sus hijos le ayudan cuando tienen tiempo y después de hacer sus oficios domésticos, se dedica a las siembras, comenta que no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que tiene dos ocupaciones, el terreno donde tiene sus siembras esta cerca de su casa la distancia es corta para llegar.  

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insecticidas, pesticidas, semilla de maíz, también desea comprar una refrigeradora para mantener sus alimentos mejor conservados.

Rosaura desea para un futuro mejorar su vivienda con el único objetivo de poder vivir cómodamente junto a sus hijos, también desea poder ayudarle a sus hijos a que puedan seguir estudiando y logran sacar una carrera universitaria para que puedan desempeñarse mejor y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 48 years old. She only studied through first grade because when she was in school, the schools were far away and because of the distance she couldn't walk to the school, so her parents opted not to have her study. She is single and has 2 children, one who is 19 years old and another who is 24 years old. The youngest studied through high school and the oldest only studied through ninth grade. They both work. Three people live in her house--her two sons and herself.

Rosaura works in the home and also, because she is a single mother, she has to work in agriculture. She plants basic grains such as corn and beans. She explains that when she was young, her father took her to work and that is how she learned this business. When she had her children, in order to support them she had to work in agriculture. She says that her sons help her when they have time. After taking care of her housework, she works on her crops. She says she doesn't have a work schedule because of the fact that she has two occupations. The land where she has her crops is close to her house, so the distance to get there isn't far. 

She will use the loan to buy pesticides and corn seed. She also wants to buy a refrigerator so she can better conserve her food.

Rosaura wants to improve her house in the future, so that she can live comfortably with her sons. She also wants to be able to help her sons continue studying so they can go to university and have better jobs and live better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and corn seed also to buy a refrigerator so she can better conserve her food.

loans.name: Hermilanda

texts.en:
Hermilanda is a tailor from  Masabud Clarin,Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

She has a tailoring business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase tailoring materials and equipment.

Hermilanda has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Hermilanda hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a yearling sheep.

loans.name: Melvin Yanira

texts.es: Melvin Yanira vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, desde hace varios años ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha cliente por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, Melvin Yanira está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, huevos, aceites, etc. y surtir aun mas su tienda para satisfacer a sus clientes cuando le lleguen a comprar y así obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Melvin Yanira lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For several years she has had a store in her place of residence. She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products she sells and the good prices. Melvin Yanira is requesting a loan in order to buy more products such as: basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, eggs, oils, etc. and to further supply her store to satisfy her clients when they arrive to her to buy and in that way obtain better earnings and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, snacks, eggs, oils, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita owns and operates a UV Express van. She has been successful in this business for 22 years and she repaid her previous loan, used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by purchasing dish-washing products and mineral water.

Related to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. She is requesting an amount of 20,000 PHP for the maintenance of the van as well as to buy more stock of other products needed in her business.

In the future, Mercedita wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and dreams of having more UV Express vans to operate for business.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance for her vehicle.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old single man from Deir El balah. He lives alone in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. Mahmoud also distributes goods in the local market using his rickshaw. This increases his income and improves his living conditions.

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products from the wholesalers and distribute them to the local traders. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his sales and his income. He would like to save some money so he can get married soon. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products from the wholesalers and sell to local traders

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en: Wilter is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She also sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of finances. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to have a successful business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Donaldo Antonio

texts.es: Donaldo de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Donaldo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Donaldo, of 36 years of age, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. For the last 10 years he has made a living through the cultivation of corn. He sells his products in the different markets that are found near his place of residence. With what he obtains from his sales, he manages to settle some expenses that turn up in his home. Donaldo is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, pest control, etc., and to improve the land that the photo shows, in order to continue with his crops and to have, together with his family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, pest control, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a 53-year-old businesswoman living in the village of Rizal in Isabela Province with her family. Alejandra, along with her family, has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for ten months by producing batches of 25 chickens every six weeks. With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to increase the number of chicks she produces to receive larger profits. With these additional profits, she intends to purchase an additional plot for rearing more chicks.

loans.use: to increase the number of chicks she produces.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She also sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to have a successful business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful farmer. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 7 children. She operates a retail business where she sells scarves. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of scarves. Her business goal is to own a big business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She plans to use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of scarves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy missing items for her shop and materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Domitiria

texts.en:
Domitria is 44 years old. She is married with six children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor during rice production

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 47 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 27 years old. She is married with three children between two and six years old. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production: She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado debido a que sus padres la enviaron a trabajar desde muy pequeña,  ya que ellos contaban con pocos recursos como para sostenerle el estudio, esta soltera y vive con sus padres, por ser la única hija mujer ella ha tenido que dedicarse más tiempo en ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar,  en la casa solo vive ella con su mamá, su papá y un hermano.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, aprendió todo de su mamá quien fue con la persona que trabajo durante toda su niñez, ella trabaja en una casa de un vecino realizando los oficios de dicho hogar, por lo cual recibe una remuneración y cuando regresa de trabajar tiene que ayudarle a su mamá a realizar los oficios del hogar donde habita.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar venenos , fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, ya que junto a su hermano están cultivando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz para tener producción y de esta manera asegurarse el alimento, el hermano es quien pone el trabajo físico y ella le ayuda en la compra de los fertilizantes y pago de un ayudante para el trabajo, teniendo estos productos en su casa ella y el hermano podrán aplicarlos a tiempo a los cultivos asegurando una producción muy buena de granos.


Ella desea poder tener una buena cosecha para tener suficientes granos para el consumo en la temporada de verano, además ella quiere construir su propia casa y formar una familia, desea tener hijos y darles una buena educación
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old. She studied through 4th grade because her parents sent her to work when she was very young, due to the fact that they had very few resources with which to support her studies. She is single and lives with her parents. Because she is the only daughter, she has had to dedicate more time to helping her mother with the housework. In her house, she lives with her mother, father, and a brother.

She has been doing housework since she was a young girl. She learned everything from her mother, who was the person she worked with during her entire childhood. She works at the house of a neighbor doing housework there, for which she recieves an income. When she returns home, she has to help her mother with the chores of their house.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay for labor; she and her brother are cultivating 7,000 square meters of corn to have production and ensure their food source. The brother is the one who does the physical work and she helps him with the fertilizers and the pay for a helper. Having these items on hand, she and her brother could apply them on time to the crop and ensure a very good grain production.

She hopes to have a good harvest so they can have enough grain for consumption during the summer months. She also wants to build her own house and start a family. She wants to have children and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay for labor because she and her brother are cultivating 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 25 bags of cement and 3 quintals [about 660 pounds] of iron, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is a 24-year-old young woman, from the village Dikhashkho. She has a husband, 2 children and a mother-in-law, who gets a pension from the local government. Tamila and her husband have a small agricultural activity and approximately generate 200-300 GEL per month. They have a milk cow, whose products are sold locally and also 100 nut trees. In order to more effectively meet their basic needs and satisfy her family's increased needs, Tamila decided to become involved in the trading business. She requested a loan of 500 GEL to purchase stock of clothing and start selling it among her friends and villagers. She will be able to generate her own income and become financially independent. 

The loan will be a great support for this hard-working woman and her family. Tamila will take care of her children's increased needs and make a better style of life for them. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María de 41años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de las edades de 26, 23, 21 y 11 años. Los dos mayores están ya casados y aparte de su vivienda y los otros dos están junto a ella uno en la universidad y la niña de 11 años está cursando cuarto grado en la escuela.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos como empleada sirviendo en una casa. Se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para dejar preparada su casa antes de salir a el trabajo que entra a las 7 de la mañana y antes prepara el desayuno para sus hijos, ella dice que desde que estaba pequeña realizaba oficios domésticos tiene ya aproximadamente 10 años de trabajar en esa vivienda y cuando era pequeña  su mamá la ponía a realizar los oficios domésticos, ella también se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas. Ella  junto a su familia siembran maíz y frijol, el horario que ella tiene no es estable para realizar con trabajos en los cultivos.

El financiamiento del préstamo, lo utilizara para terminar su vivienda que la está remodelando y le falta un complemento para seguir los trabajos en su vivienda, ella específicamente lo que hará es comprar ladrillo de piso para la casa y cemento, gracias a esta mejora ella y su familia tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, porque el piso de tierra que tenía su casa no era lo apropiado,  esto les permitirá estar libres de insectos y roedores dentro de su casa. 

En primer lugar desea María terminar su casa pues ya se acerca la época de lluvia y necesita terminar los trabajos en su casa, también desea tener un buen empleo para ella y sus hijos sigan estudiando mucho con la ayuda económica de ella, para que logren sacar una carrera universitaria y que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She is the single mother of 4 children, who are 26, 23, 21, and 11. The two oldest are already married and living outside the home, and the other two live with her. One is in college, and her 11-year-old daughter is in fourth grade.

María works for a living as domestic help in a private home. She gets up at 5am to prepare the house before leaving for work, which she begins at 7am after preparing breakfast for her children. She says that since she was a child, she has done housework, and she has already worked for about 10 years in this home. When she was a child, her mom sent her to do housework; she also works in agriculture. Along with her family, she sows corn and beans. Her schedule is too irregular to work in the cultivation of the plants.

She will use this loan to finish her house, which she is remodeling. She is lacking a little money to continue the work on her house. Specifically, she will purchase floor bricks and cement. With this improvement, she and her family will have a better quality of life because the earthen floor that she had was not suitable. As it is, it lets insects and rodents into the house.

First of all, María would like to finish her house because the rain season is approaching, and she needs to finish work on her house. She also wants to have a good job so that her children can continue going to school with the economic help that it would provide. Then they will be able to earn a university degree and be good people for society.

loans.use: to purchase floor bricks and cement for her house

loans.name: Gulhuseyn

texts.en:
Gulhuseyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to make some repairs to his home. In particular, he will put a gate to his yard. He hopes to be able to give his family a better and importantly safe living environment.

Gulhuseyn is a hardworking 31-year-old man. He is married and has three children aged 7, 5 and 4. He lives with his family in their own house in a tiny village. His wife is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children. Gulhuseyn is engaged in agriculture for his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a gate to the yard of his house.

loans.name: Byron Dario

texts.es: Byron desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra sacar adelante a su familia, Byron vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde realiza sus cultivos que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Byron has been devoting himself to agriculture for 10 years, growing corn and sorghum; and with his earnings from his sales he manages to provide for his family.  Byron lives in his own house with his wife and his two children.

He is requesting a loan with Integral for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and for improving the land where he grows his crops, which is shown in the photograph. This way, he and his family will be able to have a better quality of life, without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marcos de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive  con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, Marcos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así poder continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is 50 years old. For the past 25 years, he has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and selling his products in the area near where he lives. With what he earns from these sales, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. He lives with his wife and children in their family home.

Marcos is requesting a loan to purchase essential supplies, such as fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photo. In this way, he will be able to continue cultivating the land and can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 20 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de  maíz, vive en casa propia con su padre y su madre, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la  compra insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía  para continuar con sus cultivos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client is 20 years old and has grown corn for a living for the past 10 years. He lives in his family home with his father and mother. With the money he earns from his sales, he is able to cover some of his household's expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photo. He will continue cultivating the land and will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. and to improve the land

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been engaged in buying and selling herbal medicines and food supplements for more than eight years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of earning a better income.

To improve sales, Norma is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Norma hopes that she and her family will be financially secure. She dreams of growing her business and reaching out to other investors who can help her expand her business.

Norma meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en:
Nazli is a married retired teacher with one child. When she was a teacher, she was very interested in making handicrafts and eventually learned the craft. After she retired, an art house opened in her area and started giving public classes as well as selling the students’ handiwork in their shop.  Nazli is making her own jewelry, bags, towels and needlework, which are being sold in the shop. In the summer, she also has a small stall where she sells her goods on the seaside and would eventually like to only sell her products there and not in the art school’s shop. In this way, she believes she would have more time to focus on making more handicrafts.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
