texts.es: Segundo está separado de su esposa, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con Segundo de los mismos que 2 están en la escuela y 1 está en el colegio, Segundo se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años ya que vive en el campo y desde niño trabajaba, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semilla y para pagar la mano de obra que se utiliza para la preparación del terreno y mediante este negocio Segundo espera salir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Segundo is separated from his spouse and has eight children of which six live with Segundo. Among these, two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Segundo began working in agriculture when he was 12 years old, since he lives in the country and worked when he was a child. He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds and to pay for labor to prepare the land. Through this business, Segundo hopes to get ahead together with his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Mrika

texts.en:
Mrika is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

With the loan she is requesting, Mrika wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 40 years old. She is married with five children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production, which is needed to increase production. With the farming profits she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta 5to grado en la escuela, no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia y por el conflicto  armado que vivió el país en ese tiempo, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian, su pareja y sus hijos son los únicos que dependen de él.

Juan se dedica a trabajar como empleado en el destacamento militar, tiene 15 años de haber ingresado a esta institución a prestar el servicio militar desempeñando el cargo de cabo que es un grado militar. Decidió ingresar a la fuerza armada ya que cuando era pequeño veía películas que tenían que ver con la soberanía de la nación, fue así como un día probó suerte y con el paso del  tiempo alcanzó un mejor grado  que le ha permitido estabilidad laboral.  

El crédito lo necesita para comprar tres cerdos que le vende un vecino, él los engorda y en seguida los vende a un mejor precio, el crédito le servirá de mucho en este momento ya que no quiere perder la oportunidad de negocios porque en el futuro esto le traerá ganancias con las cuales puede mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es comprar una parcela de terreno que venden cerca de su casa con el fin de que sus hijos sean quienes hereden esa propiedad y que no tengan que andar alquilando cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old. He went to school through 5th grade. He was not able to continue his studies due to the economic situation of his family and because of the armed conflict that the country was experiencing at that time. He is married and his partner does the domestic work. He has three children, of whom only two are in school. His wife and his children are the only ones who depend on him.

Juan works as an employee in a military detachment. It has been 15 years since he entered this institution to give military service, executing the office of corporal, which is a military rank. He decided to enter the armed forces since when he was little, he saw movies that had to do with the sovereignty of the nation, and so it was that one day he tried his luck, and with the passing of time he reached a better rank, which has given him job stability.

He needs the loan to buy three pigs that a neighbor will sell him. He will fatten them and then sell them at a better price. The loan will be very useful to him at this time, since he doesn't want to lose the business opportunity, because in the future this will bring him earnings with which he can improve his quality of life.

His dream is to buy a parcel of land that they are selling near his house with the goal that his children will be the ones who inherit this property, so that they won't have to rent when they are grown up.

loans.use: to buy three pigs that a neighbor will sell to him

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy is a 32-year-old single lady who works hard to develop her business and living. She has been providing beauty services for 14 years, with a special reputation in her region.

Maguy is well known in her region for her special talents in her domain. Her acquired loan will be invested in updating her business tools with new released machines and equipment to develop her provided services. She is very anxious about this loan because she feels that it is time to update her tools to provide better facial and beauty services to her loyal customers.

She hopes that one day, the whole world will live in peace, which will improve every working sector in the region.

loans.use: To update her business tools with newly released machines and equipment to develop her services

loans.name: Girimpundu Group

texts.fr:
Moïse fait partie du groupe Girimpundu et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Anne  Marie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de  1  à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce  de bière industrielle et de la limonade depuis  8 ans. 

Il  est à son deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière et de limonade    à  revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait  acheter des parcelles  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Moses is part of the Girimpundu group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 34 years old and is married to Anne Marie, a shopkeeper. Together they have four children aged one to twelve years, including three who attend school. 

He has been trading industrial beer and lemonade for the past eight years. 

He is on his second credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy many cases of beer and lemonade to sell, to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to buy plots of land and see his children study.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many of cases of beer and lemonade to sell, to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes) to launch a business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products such as sugar, milk and soap.

loans.name: Ruhinga Group

texts.fr:
Gérard  fait partie du groupe Ruhinga et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 46 ans et est marie à Goreth, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 3 jours a 19 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de banane et de jus de banane depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  de banane une partie sera vendue et une autre  pour préparer du jus de banane    à  vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait  être capable d’élever ses enfants et les voir étudier.
texts.en:
Gerard is part of the Ruhinga group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 46 years old and is married to Goreth, a shopkeeper. Together they have eight children whose ages range from three days to 19 years, and of whom two attend school.

He has been trading bananas and banana juice for the past ten years.

This is his second credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, part of which will be sold and another used to prepare banana juice for sale, to earn more. 

In coming years, he wants to be able to raise his children and see them study.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of bananas a portion of which will be sold and another used to prepare banana juice for sale, to earn more.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 56-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He distils alcohol, a locally brewed spirit called Waragi by the natives of the land. In addition to this, he is engaged in food crop farming, which he has been practicing for the last 15 years. He has been involved in this business to earn a living. Being a hard working man, he sells the fruits of his labor to the bars and markets within his area. If given a loan, he wishes to rent a banana plantation to harvest and make alcohol to sell. He dreams of getting a self-sustaining business, although he has been limited by the fluctuating prices and limited capital to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to rent a banana plantation to make alcohol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos que aun son pequeños y están en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces que los compra de una dulcería de la zona, y que luego sale a vender de forma ambulante.
Comenta que incursionó en esta actividad hace más de 6 años, y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela, que siempre compra de ella los dulces que vende.
Ella quiere seguir trabajando en el oficio que tiene, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar dulces para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old and single mother of two school-aged children. She makes a living by selling candy as a street vendor; she buys the candy from a local candy store. 

She first engaged in this activity more than six years ago. Today, she has a strong clientele that always buys the candies she sells. 

She would like to continue her current job.; that’s why she asks for the loan to buy candy, like that she can keep moving forward as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity she received and it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy candy for resale.

loans.name: Twizereii Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  fait partie du groupe TwizereII et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 29 ans et est mariée à Boniface un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  dont 2 étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce de haricot,de  maïs, de farine,… depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande  quantité  de haricot, de maïs, de farine,…  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Beatrice is part of the Twizere II group and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and is married to Boniface, a farmer. Together they have five children, of whom two attend school. 

She has been trading beans, corn, flour, ... for the past four years. 

This is her fourth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of beans, corn, flour, ... for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years, she would like to see her children study.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of beans, corn, flour, ... for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Faida est une femme ambitieuse et trésorière  du groupe Amka/Kavumu. Agée de 42ans, mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle débuta ses activités depuis 2009 au travers le bénéfice réalisé par la vente des produits champêtres. Le prêt sollicite lui servira d’acheter  quelques sacs de farine de manioc.  Son objectif est de faire étudier ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur, les  nourrir  et changer d’activité commerciale. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de promouvoir  les  femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The featured borrower, Faida, is an ambitious woman and the treasurer of the Amka/Kavumu group.  She is 42 years old and married to a farmer.  She is also the mother of seven children who all attend school.  Faida launched her business in 2009, thanks to the profit she made from the sale of farm products.  Thanks to this loan, Faida will be able to buy a few bags of cassava flour.  Her goal is to feed her children and to support them in their studies, up to the university level.  She would also like to switch to another type of commercial activity.  She thanks Hekima for all the support they provide to low-income women.

loans.use: to buy a few bags of cassava flour.

loans.name: Bunyibunyi Group

texts.fr: Madame Kitumaini, femme  ambitieuse  est  présidente  de  la micro entreprise Bunyibunyi. Agée de 43 ans ; elle est mariée à un cultivateur et ensemble ils ont  7 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle reçu le soutien de son mari avant de bénéficier du credit de Hekima qui lui avait permis de devenir  vendeuse des souliers et  habits usagés  dans la rue. Elle sollicite ce nouveau  prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter 10 paires des souliers.  Son objectif est qu’après 8 mois elle se retrouve avec 50 paires des souliers pour quitter la rue et trouver une place au marché. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de tout cœur pour son soutien et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
Mrs.Kitumaini, an ambitious woman, is president of the Bunyibunyi micro-business. She is 43 years old, and is married to a farmer. Together they have seven children who all go to school.

She received support from her husband before being granted the Hekima loan, which enabled her to become a street vendor of second-hand clothes and shoes. She is requesting this new loan so she can buy 10 pairs of shoes.

Her aim is to have after eight months 50 pairs of shoes, so she can leave the street and find a place at the market.

She heart-fully thanks Hekima for their support and asks God to bless them.

loans.use: buy 10 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Murhula Group

texts.fr: Madame Nzigire  est une femme dynamique, d’une grande expérience et  membre du groupe de credit  Murhula.  Agée de 40 ans, elle est  mariée à un chômeur et mère de 7 enfants  qui  vont  à l’école. Elle demande ce nouveau credit  pour lui permettre d’acheter  6 bidons d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite devenir une grande commerçante. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de promouvoir  les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nzigire is a dynamic woman with great experience, who is an affiliate of the Murhula loan group. Aged 40, she is married to an unemployed man, and is the mother of seven children who go to school.

She is requesting this new loan to enable her to buy six containers of palm oil. She wants to become a great trader.

She wishes to thank Hekima for promoting impoverished women who are economically active.

loans.use: buy six containers of palm oil

loans.name: Mario Arquimides

texts.es:
Mario tiene 31 años de edad  de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Mario se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, choclo, mora y a la cría de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. Las compras realizan en el mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y la venta de ganado. En su tiempo libre hace deporte y disfrutar de las fiestas de cantonización.
texts.en:
Mario is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “La Palmira”, which is located in the community of La Pamira and approximately 40 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The group consists of 14 members who are from the same community. They all engage in agriculture.

Mario is a farmer who grows corn, maize, and blackberries. He also raises livestock. Mario is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock. His purchases are conducted at the market in Chillanes. His goal is to increase his planting and sell livestock.

In his free time, Mario likes to play sports and enjoys the patron saint festivals.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para fortalecer más sus actividades agrícolas, ya que tiene mejores ingresos económicos, le servirá para comprar abonos, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas y semilla, así preparara el terreno de manera adecuada para sembrar y seguir mejorando su productividad. 
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior su cosecha de maíz fue muy abundante dejándole ganancias que ha invertido en dar a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable y cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Manuel decided to request a new loan so that he could strengthen his farming activities. He has already experienced improvements in his earnings. The loan will be used to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, and seeds. He will be able to adequately prepare the land for planting, which will allow him to continue improving his productivity.

With the help of his previous loan, Manuel experienced an abundant corn harvest. The profit he generated was invested in a more comfortable lifestyle for his family and was also used to repay his debt.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more watches and other items

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
Juma, a teen near his 20s, is single. He has been taking care of his welfare with a barbershop business. He starts working from  8 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good return each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first credit, which he will use to buy a nice barbershop chair. Juma dreams of expanding his business to a classic level. He will share this loan with his loan group, "CHIRIKU," which consist of two members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a nice barbershop chair.

loans.name: Bosibori

texts.en:
Bosibori is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of fruits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es: Julio tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Julio se dedica a la venta de zapato, bolsones, verduras, etc. de forma ambulante. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y trata e dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  Julio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para la mamá para lo cual necesita materiales como: madera, lámina, cemento, arena, etc. Espero poder contar con este crédito y así dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su madre.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old and resides in his own home along with his mother. He sells shoes, backpacks, vegetables, and other products as a street vendor. This is how he sustains his household and provides better living conditions for his family.

Julio is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the construction of a room for his mother. He needs materials such as wood, metal sheets, cement, sand, and other items. Julio hopes to receive this loan so that he can provide better living conditions for his mother.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Estefany Liliana

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Chiclayo junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Administración, Hotelería y Turismo en un Instituto de la Ciudad donde vive. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Cosmetóloga en la Galería de la zona donde vive y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y porque brinda servicios de calidad a sus clientes.
Estefany está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina para que los platillos preparados sean de mejor calidad, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida, y continuará trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su propia Estética"
texts.en:
Estefany is an enterprising young woman who is 20 years of age. She is single and lives with her family in Chiclayo.

Estefany is studying for a degree in Hotel and Tourism Management at an institute in the city where she lives. For more than a year, she has worked as a cosmetologist at a local shopping center. She is doing very well because she is a responsible and hardworking person who provides quality service to her customers.

Estefany is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have provided. She will be able to buy a stove so that she can prepare dishes that are of better quality and improve her quality of life. Estefany continues to work with great effort and dedication so that she can fulfill her dream of having her own aesthetics shop.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana used the previous loan to buy feed for her pigs. She has three children aged between 30 and 20 and all attend school. Juliana is still practicing farming as her major business, aiming at raising her income.  She later supplemented it with motorcycle transport located in Fort Portal, Uganda. She needs a loan to pay for labor to improve her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labor to improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Margarita is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her pedicure business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her pedicure business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 37-year-old married mother of two. She is a Syrian citizen who works hard with her husband, who's a blacksmith, to provide their children with the necessary education and living needs.

Nelly has been working in selling Tupperware and plastic home products since 2011 with 14 years of overall experience in this domain. Nelly has a good reputation in her region with a good number of customers whom she visits to sell her products. She has good communication skills and special public relations, which she invests in expanding and developing her working sector.

Nelly is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business capital with newly released products that will attract customer attention and increase her sales.

Nelly hopes to open her own selling shop and build a selling team of her own.

loans.use: To increase her business capital with newly released products that will attract customer attention and increase her sales

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Mr. Bayaraa, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a steel factory since 2013. His wife is a cook and works at a restaurant. Their elder son stays at home due to a disability. The other son goes to high school and will graduate next year. 

Bayaraa is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy a block machine in order to run a block sales business. There is a growing demand for blocks for construction, and if he can use this opportunity, he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a block machine

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour and other household items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area. 

He will use the 80,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, bread and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better business person. This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to boost the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase constructions materials such as cement, flagstones and bricks in order to renovate the house.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melba is 26 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Melba has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melba requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Melba has been in this business for six years. In the future, Melba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana, who is a 34-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Misaktsieli with her husband. They have 3 school-aged children and live in poverty.

The only source of the family's income is Manana's husband's job, working as a driver and getting 400 GEL monthly. It's clear that a 5 member-family can't cover basic needs with this income alone. Therefore Manana decided to somehow do her bit for the family's welfare, and she has started her own activity. She has requested a loan and has been approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo: the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the money she will purchase a stock of clothing and start trading. She will have a wide assortment of women's, men's and children's clothing and will get private orders.
 
Manana will be really grateful for your help and will greatly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of clothing to start trading

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Battungalag

texts.en:
Battungalag, 54 years old, lives with her daughter and granddaughter in Darkhan, the  second largest city of Mongolia. She and her daughter have been growing vegetables for domestic use and sale since 2009. They also raise livestock and sell dairy products for a living. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to build a greenhouse on her land so that she can grow tomatoes and cucumbers during the cold season. As a result, she will be able to continue to grow vegetables even during winter and use the surplus vegetables for trade.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 39-year-old married mother of two, who has been working in shoe tailoring since 2011. She runs her business from her house, and is working hard to develop it. When her business increases and expands in the future, she would like to move to a bigger place.

Fatima's husband works as a taxi driver and needs to do maintenance on his car to earn more money to cover their family's increasing living expenses. Therefore Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to help her husband. As their combined income isn't enough to cover sudden, unpredicted needs like this, Al Majmoua agreed that the requested loan amount is necessary.

loans.use: To help her husband to do the necessary maintenance on his car for work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Munavvarjon

texts.en:
Munavvarjon is 21 years old and is a very hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law.

Munavvarjon has been busy with her bakery - she has a workshop where she cooks flatbreads. She has worked in this field for more than 2 years. Her husband and father-in-law help her to cook the flatbreads. 

Unfortunately Munavvarjon is now ill, and she has to buy medication for treatment. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy this medication. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medication for treatment

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her fifties, is married and has got three children, one of whom is in school and two of whom are grown-up. 

She is a business woman with two businesses. ONE is a shop selling drinks, such as beers, sodas, water and spirits, to small sellers. Lastly is poultry with layer and broiler chickens. She has been in her businesses for nine years and is able to accumulate a good profit each month. 

Though Anna is able to make a good return, it is not satisfactory. She wants more stocks to meet the growing demand to her businesses. She starts working from 10:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily. 

This is her eighth loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Mpipi, a two-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to start selling local chickens. She replenished her shop with more beverages. Anna received a profit, which she used to build a house for her parents and pay school fees and home food expenses. 

She will use her portion of the loan to buy shop beverages (crates of beers, soda, boxes of water and spirits). 

Her ambition is to greatly improve her family life.

loans.use: to buy shop beverages such as crates of beers, soda, boxes of water and spirits.

loans.name: Armik

texts.en:
Armik lives in Stepanavan city in the Lori region. He graduated from the college of Veterinary but never worked as a veterinarian. For many years he worked as a worker at a construction company. Now he works at the Stepanavan military unit as a senior mechanic and driver. 

Armik is married, and he has two nice children: a son and a daughter. His wife does not work, and she is busy with the care of their lovely children. Armik’s salary is so much that it can only cover the first needs of his family. Still he wants so much to make presents and surprises for his children and see how they are happy and cheerful for the gifts, for which it is such a pity that he does not have enough finances. 

Armik asks this loan in order to make a surprise for his son and to present him with a computer, which his son just dreams of. 

Armik thanks beforehand and hopes that Kiva lenders will help him to realize his son’s dream.

loans.use: to make a surprise for his son and to present him with a computer, which his son just dreams of

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested an 8,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 50-year-old, married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been living and working in a Palestinian camp since she was born. She used to work in agriculture, but her body became weak and this kind of business became very tiring for her, and that is why she opened her current grocery store in 2007.
 
The income that she earns running the store is necessary to help her husband, who works as a fisherman with a very low income, to make their living and cover their children's increasing needs.

Iman is acquiring her sixth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise by adding special summer beverages and ice cream.

Her previous loans helped her a lot to develop her newly-established business, and she has proved to be reliable in paying back her loans. She is a borrower in good standing.

Iman is working hard to keep on developing and expanding her business in good ways, and she hopes to start wholesale trading in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by adding special summer beverages and ice cream

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a female Kiva borrower with 4 children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be operating the business in a temporary structure. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years.

She hopes that in the future she will be a better person.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nueva Esperanza, lleva este nombre por la esperanza que tienen todas ellas de poder salir adelante y crecer en el emprendimiento de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica exclusivamente al macate (venta de forma ambulante) y  también en la cría de animales. Ella comenta que con la lucha constante del día a día también se dedica a los cultivos de frutas y verduras  consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser  constante para lograr el progreso que anhela alcanzar.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Nueva Esperanza (New Hope), for the hope that they all have to be able to get ahead and grow their individual business ventures.

One of the members is María, a very hardworking and enterprising person who works exclusively as a mobile salesperson and as an animal farmer. She comments that, with her struggle day in and day out, she also grows fruits and vegetables, and she is aware that this work she is doing and the effort she is making must be constant in order to achieve the progress she longs for.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, so that in this way she can continue with her work, fighting to get ahead and help her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco es soltero no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Marco trabaja como albañil y quiere un prestamo para comprar taladro, planchas, regla y cubetas para su actividad Marco recibe ayuda de sus padres pero esto no es suficiente por lo que necesita ayuda
texts.en: Marco is single; he has no children and lives with his parents in the city of La Paz, in a brick and cement house that belongs to his family. Marco works as a builder and wants a loan to buy a drill, sheeting, a measuring tool, and buckets for his work. Marco gets help from his parents, but it isn't enough, and so he needs help.

loans.use: to buy a drill, sheeting, a measuring tool, and buckets for his work

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.fr: Madame  Peru  est conseillère de l’association de credit Mwangaza. Mariée à un fonctionnaire de l’Etat Congolais, elle est mère de 6 enfants dont seulement 4 vont  à l’école.  Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile depuis si peu.  Elle sollicite un nouveau credit pour lui permettre d’acheter  1 sac de kg de sucre. Le plus grand obstacle qu’elle rencontre dans ses activités c’est le vol. Son rêve est d’évoluer et devenir une grande commerçante. Au finish,  Elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Peru is advisor to the Mwangaza loan association. Married to a civil servant of the Congolese State, she is the mother of six children, of whom only four attend school. 

Only recently she began displaying her merchandise from her home. She is requesting a new loan credit so she can buy one bag of sugar. The greatest obstacle she faces in her activities is theft.

Her dream is to grow and become a great trader. Finally, she wishes to thank Hekima.

loans.use: buy one bag of sugar

loans.name: Cikwanine Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwavita est conseillère de l’association de crédit Chikwanine. Mariée à un homme d’affaire, elle est  mère  de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle effectue les activités de commerce depuis 2008 au marché public. Agée de  47ans, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter  15 bidons d’huile de palme et 100kg de farine  de froment. Elle projette agrandir son entreprise et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau universitaire. Au final, elle rend grâce à Dieu et bénie Hekima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mwavita is advisor to the Chikwanine loan association. Married to a businessman, she is the mother of six children who all attend school.

She has been a retail merchant at the public market since 2008. She is 47 years old, and is requesting a loan to buy 15 containers of palm oil and 100 kilos of wheat flour.

She plans to expand her business and ensure her children's education up to university level.

Finally, she gives thanks to God and blesses Hekima.

loans.use: buy 15 containers of palm oil and 100 kilos of wheat flour.

loans.name: Gilma Marisela

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 31 años de edad, está estudiando bachillerato los días sábados, está casada y su esposo trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa privada, ha procreado 2 hijos en su matrimonio, que tienen entre 7 y 10 años de edad y estudian en la escuela, con ella viven sus suegros pero solo sus hijos dependen de ella. 

Gilma se dedica solamente a los oficios domésticos y se mantiene pendiente de las siembras de granos básicos que realiza su esposo, ya que él llega a su casa cada dos días, y no lo le queda más que trabajar ella también. Antes Gilma se dedicaba a trabajar con su mamá vendiendo pan. 

Ella necesita el dinero para cancelar el crédito que tiene pendiente en la institución, otra parte la invertirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos. También pretende ayudar a su esposo en la compra de una motocicleta para que se transporte más luego al lugar de trabajo  ya que tiene que viajar en bus.

El sueño de Gilma es que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria, y ella pretende seguir estudiando y en seguida poder encontrar un trabajo digno que le ayude a tener mejor calidad de vida, otro de sus sueños es construir su propia vivienda para que sus hijos tengan más privacidad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Gilma is 31 years old. She is studying high school on Saturdays. She is married and her husband works as a security agent in a private business. They have 2 children from the marriage that are 7 and 10 years old. They study in school and her in-laws live with her, but only her children depend on her.

Gilma is only in domestic work for a living and she keeps watch over basic grain crops that her husband grows, so that he can come home every other day and not leave her more work. Before Gilma worked selling bread with her mother for a living.

She needs funds to pay off a loan she has pending at an institution. Another part she will invest in buying agricultural inputs for her crops. Also she wants to help her husband to buy a motorcycle so that he can transport to work, as now he travels via bus.

Gilma's dream is that her children study a university career and she wants to continue studying and be able to find a decent job that will allow her to have a better quality of life. Her other dreams are to construct her own housing so that her children have more privacy and comfort.

loans.use: to pay off the loan that she has pending at the institution. The other part she will invest in agricultural inputs for her crops. Also she wants to help her husband with the purchase of a motorcycle so that he can transport to work as now he travels by bus

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il compte 26 femmes très dynamiques, elles  vivent dans le même village et sont dans le programme des bancs villageois depuis plus une décennie. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Coumba (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main  levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Très active au sein du banc villageois. Elle est âgée de 48  ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme, de savon de fabrication artisanale. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et maîtrise à merveille les contours dans ce domaine.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire  acheter des bidons d’huile de palme à 750 F CFA le litre, des cartons de savon et investir le reste en semence pour la culture d’arachide. 

Les bénéfices réalises lui permettent d’augmenter son épargne  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The group was created December 5, 2000 at the inauguration of their "banc villageois" loan association. It comprises 26 very active women, who live in the same village and have been in the "banc villageois" program for over a decade. Their main activity is to run small businesses.

Mrs. Coumba (seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. Very active in the "banc villageois", she is 48 years old, married and the mother of seven children including three girls and four boys.

She is active in selling palm oil and homemade soap. She has been performing this activity for over 10 years and masters perfectly all of its aspects.

With the new loan she wants to buy cans of palm oil at 750 CFA francs per liter, cartons of soap, and invest the rest in seeds for groundnut cultivation.

The generated profits will enable her to increase her savings and support her husband in managing the children's tuition fees.

loans.use: buy cans of palm oil at 750 CFA francs per liter, cartons of soap and invest the rest in seeds for groundnut cultivation.
